Reviews.Title: “Hit 'n Miss”
Reviews.Author: ptlvr
Reviews.Content: I don't want to write a negative review of this property, but there were some things I was unhappy about. The "hits" are all outlined by previous reviewers- and I concur with them all. But I considered the room to be nothing more than a Best Western type with fancier beds and better towels. Did like the balconey tho. Too bad about the stereo "sucker trucks" working on the storm drains, one at the bottom of the hill and one at the top. Incredibly noisy machines, but obviously not the hotel's fault. The breakfast, however, was their fault. The "hot breakfast", as was advertised, did not include potatoes or any kind of meats- staples in most people's hot breakfasts. And putting a few sprigs of rosemary in the instant eggs doesn't hide the fact that they are instant eggs. My final comment, perhaps, sums up my mixed feeling best: When we returned home there was a message from the hotel. The cleaning staff had found "a multi-coloured belt" in our room and they'd be happy to ship it back to us. Hmm. Very nice. One problem- it wasn't our belt. Wonder how long it went unnoticed... There are "misses" tho. Twice I called down to the desk and asked for help and both times nobody showed. And both times when I called back a 2nd time to let them know I`d solved the issue myself, I was told that the person I`d been waiting for "was sitting right beside (me)" at the desk- as apposed to being en route to our room to fix the problem. Not cool.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient location”
Reviews.Author: xpastNevada
Reviews.Content: Location is very close to everything a Seattle visitor would want to see. Across the street from the Seattle Art Museum, just steps from the wharf and a nice walk to Pike's Market. We stayed in Rm 51 with three adults, the offset queen beds worked out fine for us. We travel with a guide dog and, by watching other dog folks, it was easy to figure out good relieving areas...be sure to be a responsible dog owner and remove any wastes left anywhere. There was quite a bit of traffic noise at night from ongoing construction and several highways nearby. The complimentary breakfasts and afternoon wine and cheese were certainly were excellent, more than expected, nice! Many top class restaurants nearby: the Brooklyn, Elliotts and the Space Needle (for lunch). Almost any cuisine is available. Many thanks to Emily at the main desk. Emily is very knowledgeable, friendly and caring. Michael was also very helpful. The light rail is a fun trip in itself and very inexpesive!

Reviews.Title: “Better than a standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: OceanBoulevard
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 12 which is actually the size of a studio suite. There is a working fireplace, armchairs, sink and fridge. The bathroom was huge. The bed is clearly quite new and firm. Most people would find this comfortable but I am used to sleeping on memory foam, so I found it a little too firm. A morning breakfast buffet is included in the price. This is high quality food with a lot of choices. Everything is made fresh including the muffins and quiche. There were 5 kinds of juice, 2 hot dishes, hot cereal, cold cereal, choices of bread, fruit and even soy milk. Many hotels advertise an included breakfast but this one rates 5 stars! There is also "afternoon tea" from 4 p.m. to 6:30. This is also extensive and includes red and white wine, coffee, teas, cheese, crackers, crudites with dip, fruit, and a fresh baked dessert. I didn't bother going out for dinner after this. On the downside, Room 12 has no telephone. I don't carry a cell due to roaming charges, so I had to go to the front desk to use a phone. However, there was a desktop available in the lobby. I was told the wiring in Room has to be re-done. There is no way to contact the desk once you are in this room if you don't carry a cell. The morning and early afternoon staff are very helpful and friendly. However, the young lady who works afternoons needs communication training. Her presentation of information is fast and disorganized. It is better to speak with the earlier shift. The location of this hotel is excellent. The Seattle Art Museum is across the street, Pike Place Market is a very short walk, and downtown shopping is also 6 blocks away. A large number of restaurants and bistros are close by. There is no need for a car. In fact, I was told that parking is $25 per day. When I stayed there was a 2 nights for 1 deal offered from Sunday to Thursday. Considering the meals and the location of this hotel, I felt it was a real deal. The regular price for my room would be outside my budget. I would stay here again if I could get the 2 for 1 deal and overall, I recommend this hotel. But if you need a phone in your room, make that clear when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KateandEd
Reviews.Content: This Inn is a great place if you are going to spend time in Seattle. It is close to all that the downtown offers (e.g., restaurants, ferries, shopping, bars, Pike Market, Seattle Art Museum etc.) but also easy access to public transportation to sights around Seattle. We caught the light rail from the airport and it took us just a couple blocks from the Inn. We booked a tour through the Inn, they picked us up right out front (on time) and we had a wonderful time. Breakfast was delicious. We especially liked the potatoes and egg dishes. Tea time was also great. Plenty of wine and wonderful cheeses and sweets. Another plus is the warm, cozy robes that are provided and add to that the fireplace that was cozy when returning from a fun, but damp day in the city! The staff was friendly and helpful. They kept our bags for us so we could have another day in the city before catching our flight that night. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Dragonflydeb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn for a girls weekend for my mom's 75th birthday, We had three rooms, 2 double queens, and 1 single queen. My mom had the single queen, which had a fireplace and a sitting area, and was near the breakfast room and group seating area; she loved it. My sister and I shared a double queen, and were happily surprised by the size of the room, and how comfortable it was for 2 people to share, and still have some private space. Our room also had a seating area with 2 chairs. I had been a little nervous about the Inn based on some of the reviews, but we all loved it, and would definitely return. I would rate it a 4.5 if there was the option to do that; its not perfect, but it was a wonderful place to stay and we would do it again. Pro's - - amazingly large rooms, especially the doubles - seating area in all rooms - abundant breakfast with frittata, scrambled eggs, potatoes, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, and a variety of muffins and breads - the wine and cheese included decent wine, cheese, a fabulous blue cheese salad, hummis, artichoke dip, and veggies (I'm sure I've left something out too) - great amenities in the rooms - awesome location, can't be beat! - good value for the money Con's - on our floor, some of the apartment residents were really noisy when returning (we were there for St. Patrick's day); fortunately, we only heard them as they passed, and that was the only noise - the rooms could use a little freshening, but there were certainly acceptable We all agreed that we would go back and stay there again; the location is right on the water, and near all sorts of things to do, and great restaurants. We really had a great stay. It is true that the inn is surrounded by apartments, but we didn't find this a problem at all (except for the noisy people, but that could happen in any hotel!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, can't have a better location.”
Reviews.Author: kimmyk2314
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at Harbor Steps in March and if you are looking to see everything in downtown Seattle (Pike place market, take a ferry, go to the art museum, etc) this is the place to be. The service was impeccable, they were willing to go the extra mile with everything from holding our bags til the room was ready to helping us with reservations and even finding a vase for the flowers we bought at the market. The inn has a very homey feel (fresh baked cookies at check in!) and even has an extensive library that you can borrow books from. They have breakfast every morning and cocktail hour in the afternoons. The breakfast had quite a few items like eggs, toast, oatmeal, potatoes and fruit. The only complaint that we had was that day 2 of breakfast was EXACTLY the same as day 1, down to the same exact quiche. Our last morning there we went out for breakfast because we weren't really interested in eating the same thing 3 days in a row. But it was nice to have the option of not going out. We went to 1 cocktail hour while staying there and it was great! Great snacks and good wine (although I'm not picky with my wine, I like it all!). I highly recommend the Inn at Harbor Steps for your next downtown Seattle hotel! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “like a cozy cottage”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen G
Reviews.Content: The experience of this hotel is different because it is a small part of a large fancy hotel tower. There is a jar of truly homemade cookies on the check in counter which is really the only hint of what a great place this is. Our room moved us from the hustle of downtown to the hush of a sweet large room set up like a charming home, with a fireplace, french doors over a terrace, books and knicknacks, and two cozy armchairs. It is very homelike. They have a wine/food get together in the late afternoon and a truly homemade breakfast that is one of the best I've seen. The downside? Well the bathroom isn't anything fancy. If you like a nice tub this won't do. But you do have access to a nice fitness center and two hot tubs. Also, they need to upgrade the mattresses. These are old style, with too much wiggle. Also--it's across from nice art galleries and the Art Musuem. Plus a block away from the University station of the light rail to the airport, so it is very convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever had the pleasure to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: Lorie R
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the front doors, we were thrilled with this hotel. The staff is incredibly welcoming and couldn't do enough for us. Super friendly and helpful throughout our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, great location, poor execution”
Reviews.Author: Jpmcdonough
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn over a long weekend in December, 2011, a very slow time for Seattle. The property is part of an apartment tower. There are 30 guest rooms. We arrived after a morning flight, knowing check-in time was 3 PM but hoping for the best. We got in around noon. The reception was cool, to say the least. We were permitted to drop off our suitcases, and they took my number to call us when the room was ready. We had lunch, wandered around, got really tired, hung out in a pub, and came back to the inn at around 2:30. We were told our room had just become available. I wasn't born yesterday - it just wasn't a priority. The front desk people were consistently diffident. I went there one time to ask a question, but three of them were talking animatedly about something and didn't even look up. The staff at the adjacent desk, supporting the apartment building, were consistently friendly and helpful, even though we were not their clients. Our suite was nice - comfy king size bed, huge bathroom, low def TV, work desk, wet bar and fridge in the sitting room. There were two simple problems with the room. Despite the very nice furnishings, we found it hard to read in the room because the lights were too dim. And the bathroom had cheap single-ply Costco toilet paper. There is no wi-fi in the room, but there was an ethernet jack. I couldn't use it - my MacBook Air doesn't have ethernet - but neither could anyone else, because the port was 10 feet away and at a right angle from the desk. The breakfast was good, some nice variety. The afternoon hors-d'ouvres were nice, but the wine probably came out of a box. The room was quiet and comfortable, but I can't give the hotel more than an average rating due to the issues noted above. The location is FABULOUS. Across the street from the Seattle Art Museum, one block from the light rail to the airport. A couple of blocks from the Pike Street Market.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn at Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Corinn45
Reviews.Content: Loved this place on our recent stay in Seattle. Very close to Pike's Market, everything downtown, and 10 minute walk to space needle and baseball/football stadiums. Great view from our room of Puget Sound. Room was HUGE and nice - free breakfast was a great touch with good variety of food - much more than "continental" as they served two egg dishes, oatmeal, etc. Buildings were secure and safe. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Location is wonderful, hotel needs major improvement”
Reviews.Author: jacqso
Reviews.Content: I have been looking forward to staying at this hotel for a couple years. So when we arrived and I saw it is part of an apartment building I cringed. Then when we finally got past the locked front door and the apartment lobby staff was so much more friendly than the hotel's staff, I began to get frustrated. This was a birthday trip for my husband, and I chose this hotel so I didn't want to disappoint him on a special weekend. We got a blur of information including parking instructions-you have to drive down two blocks, circle down behind the apartments and park in a public lot. The desk clerk did not say it was a public lot, so that was fun to figure out. In a relatively short amount of time we make it back up to the hotel and were shown to our room. The fireplace is really nice to have in your room. And their robes are wonderful. But, for now, that is where the nice ends. The bed was so hard and my pillow was so flat I woke the next day with a sore back and neck. That hasn't ever happened to me in a hotel before. Our towels smelled so strong of some chemical, I couldn't stand to use them. Rust stains around the toilet were unappealing. And I had to run the water for several minutes before I had hot water for a shower. ? How does that happen in a hotel like this??? French doors were opened immediately because the room smelled-we kept them open as much as possible. I can't place what it was, it just didn't smell good. When we opened the french doors, we noticed the white blinds were dirty, too. The lamp had a burn spot on the shade and the bedside table's laminate top was peeling. So cleanliness was poor, service was very poor, and initial presentation (including dirty elevator floors, maintenance carts parked in the lobby all day, and a locked front door you have to get buzzed into) was very poor. The next morning I hoped the next shift of staff would be better. But not really. We asked at the front desk for information on public transit to the football stadium for a game we were going to later in the afternoon. The clerk pointed us to a train tunnel two blocks up, so that was helpful. But it would have been really nice if she had also told us the buses in the tunnel run the same course and they are free. A great piece of information for downtown guests to have... Upside: staying in a hotel right by the market and the waterfront was so much fun. We saw a part of downtown Seattle we have never explored on foot, and we have been going to Seattle for a lot of years. I know there are a lot of hotels downtown to choose from, so if you are debating if it is worth it to stay downtown, it is so worth it to stay there! No hassle with finding parking downtown, come back to the hotel if you want a break, public transit is so close and takes you all over if you don't want to drive, and more to see and do around every corner than you could ever do. Really, really nice to be down in the heart of things. The breakfast and the afternoon cocktail hour are good. The food service area looks very clean and well presented. But that is not enough to make us go back to the Inn at Harbor Steps. And I would not search out a Four Sisters Inn since this one was so poor. I submitted a survey to the hotel and I will say the same thing here: this was like a hotel which wants to be upscale but just isn't willing to really put in the level of effort it takes. Sad when we traveled from Eastern Washington for a special weekend in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific”
Reviews.Author: Tia S
Reviews.Content: For the price go somewhere else. The pictures on the internet are cleaner than the rooms. The beds are hard, queen beds are really double beds. I found long black hairs in the sheets. Also, the rooms stink like a mix of perfume, incense & food. I felt like I needed a shower after being in the room for five minutes. I won't even talk about the breakfast they offer!!!! So I left and went to the Waterfront Marriott and it was great there especially clean!!!!! Only positive I have to say is the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “next time we will stay at the Alexis”
Reviews.Author: cctravelercc
Reviews.Content: Calling this place an Inn is a strange choice- 28 rooms in the basement of an apt building isn't my vision of an Inn or B&B. the rooms and lobby are Ok, but worn and outdated. location is great, but stay somewhere else! The breakfast is ok, but about the same as what you would get at a Hampton Inn. happy hour is marginal- cheap box wine. overall, too much money for what you get! I will never ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else for the same amount of money.”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Trav
Reviews.Content: Rooms were not in good shape. Multiple stains on the carpet. Many rooms wiithout a view and next to a loud bar. For the price there are better hotels. They positive comments I have is the hotel includes a hot breakfast, happy hour wine with cheese, nice place to sit outside to enjoy happy hour, and bakery cookies. Don't expect more than what a three star hotel would provide and prepare for the noise you will hear at night. I moved to the hotel monaco which had better and more clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Part of an apartment building.”
Reviews.Author: Richard N
Reviews.Content: This hotel has seen much better days! Ten years ago it was unique and spotless. Now it is well used and the staff could care less about the guests. The afternoon wine and cheese, a feature of this hotel chain, is taken over and consumed by residents of the attached apartment complex; no place for hotel guests to sit and the wine is all gone! Skip this one and stay at The Four Seasons a block closer to Pike Street Market.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location in nice seattle”
Reviews.Author: xs2alex
Reviews.Content: Quiet, right place. Nice room. It is a fine base for exploring Seattle. Service is fine. Breakfast is average, pity.

Reviews.Title: “A special treat”
Reviews.Author: NorthernBurt
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was hoping for something special. We got a lot more than that. The hotel is really the bottom floor of a modern high-rise apartment building and offers all it's amenities. Our room was really a suite overlooking a lovely garden. The ceilings were probably twelve feet tall with comparable widows and there was a kitchen with a full size refrigerator (with two free bottles of water chilled inside). Furnishings were modern and comfortable. Free wi-fi is available but requires a cable (which they will loan to you). Delightful full breakfast is offered every morning and late afternoon there is a selection of wine, cheeses, cakes, specialty teas, etc. On Friday night the building has a generous free bar-b-q with wine and all the trimmings.. and the hotel guests are invited to join-in. The location is excellent, across the street from the Seattle Art Museum which is a top grade museum with an excellent variety of art. If you step out the front door of the hotel and immediately turn left, you can walk a short way to a public elevator that will take you down to waterfront level (avoiding all the steps....use it to get back up) and a short block takes you to the waterfront with many tourist attractions... an excellent restaurant.. and several different harbor cruise boats. You can walk down the same street as the hotel and in a few blocks you'll be in the market section where you can watch them "throw the fish". Best of all are the front desk young ladies who are as friendly and capable as they are, attractive. I'm proud to sign my review, Burt Katz.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AmberLake
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with excellent customer service. Morning breakfast was very good and the afternoon wine/cheese was also very nice. We stayed in a King Jacuzzi room. Great view of the courtyard. Hotel is close to everything we wanted to see. Only thing that would make this a perfect hotel is a mattress upgrade. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast and good location for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: LABillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our Alaska cruise and were very happy with the choice. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast options are more than typical conteniental fare - made from scratch options like quiche, plenty of fresh fruit, cereals, and yogurt. The location is very convenient for public transportation from the airport and a quick walk to the Pike Market.

Reviews.Title: “We always enjoy the Four Sisters”
Reviews.Author: 1CaliforniaBoy
Reviews.Content: We found the room to be clean and the service was quite good. There is a breakfast included which was also good. The Inn is located in central Seattle with a number of attractions close by. Parking is challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan15
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Harbor Steps has two valuable things going for it: location and room size. Both were very good for anyone visiting Seattle and, given those two factors, we are glad we stayed there. Its foibles, however, were many -- in no particular order: -Room was dark and had poor ventilation. No windows other than a French door that opened onto a fake balcony that faced a populated alleyway that was noisy at times and offered little privacy. We wanted the door open just for air (the room was very stuffy), but originally noise prevented us from doing that, and then the door actually came off its hinges and was not safe to open. We happened to be here on a hot weekend (rare, I realize), and the air conditioner in the room was our next resort, but it was not working well and was noisy going on and off at unplanned times (??) so we had to turn that off overnight. -Insufficient artificial lighting (small lamps in a dark and large room). -Free wifi is NOT available in your room unless you tap into the network from Tully's, a nearby coffee shop. The free wifi advertised by the hotel is only available in the common areas of the hotel and requires an access code that changes every time you log on. This was totally inconvenient, so we relied on Tully's (thank, Tully's!). -The water pressure in the shower was weak. Any of these things may seem trivial, and if I were not paying top dollar I would not be surprised to find the place a little down in the heels. But the price clearly buys you the location and the room size, so if you can find a place near Pike Place Market with more reliable amenities, I would go for that.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Four Sisters Inn??”
Reviews.Author: evansemery
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at several Four Sisters Inns and visited Seattle many times and it was hard to believe this is one of their properties. The inn is actually part of a high rise apartment building. Pike Place Market is just a few steps away as is the waterfront and ferry. But the inn (in the 2 floors BELOW ) is rather industrial appearing and long overdue for updating...think 1980's TV and outdated small tub/shower combination. Our room (#20) was unusually large but quite dark even with all lights on and a sunny day! Internet connection only available with a special cord which had to be connected across the entire room (potentially dangerous trip factor), and to download anything on my Kindle (daily newspapers) I had to go up to the lobby. Breakfast is quite nice but they were inconsistent with opening times. On our second morning, they were 30 minutes late.. not even open for coffee until 0730. Another puzzling part of our visit was the front desk... no one seemed particular interested in being there and when we checked out at 0700 on a Saturday with advance notice, no one was available! This was concerning because we had paid a $50 deposit on our room keys (yes, they still use the old fashioned metal keys) and a deposit on the internet cord! Thankfully, the apartment manager just steps away took responsibility for our keys and it was obvious this was not the first time he has been put in this position. On a brighter note, Kevin and David were both friendly and most helpful when I had a problem with my Kindle. After reading several negative reviews, I also wondered why management does not respond to comments?? Would not stay again despite the excellent location. For these prices ($167 + taxes weekday and $250 + taxes Friday night) we will stay somewhere else on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Did not feel like we were staying at a hotel, it was so spacious!”
Reviews.Author: missd82
Reviews.Content: I LOVED the garden room we stayed at, and how it did not feel like we were staying at a hotel, it felt more like a room in a house. I got a good nights sleep in the hotel room, and felt very comfortable staying there! The location is also very close to all the things you would want to walk to, close to stores, and close to the delicious cheesecake factory! It was an amazing place for me and my boyfriend to stay at, and the whole time we did not feel like we were in a hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad.”
Reviews.Author: enzane2000
Reviews.Content: The room was rather grubby and the beds were subpar, as was almost everything about the place except the location. We were disappointed and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a little more elegence for the price”
Reviews.Author: hernse1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, very close to the Pike Market and in walking distance to many attractions in downtown Seattle. The room looked like it could use a facelift, it just looked a little tired. I expected something a little more fancy for the price. They offer wine and hors d'oevres but there was only cheese and a few crackers out along with the wine. The room was suprisingly quiet given its location. There was a very loud noise made by the pipes when we first used the sink and toilet in the room but thankfully that went away. As we were preparing to check out of the room we noticed a guy right outside our room washing the windows, but yet it was a good hour before official check out time. I'm glad I had the blinds mostly closed but I thought that was weird.

Reviews.Title: “We love Inn at Harbor Steps”
Reviews.Author: smartlabelprint
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 times. Walking distance to everything good in Seattle. Things are getting a bit dated including furniture and linens. We enjoy the wine & Hors d’oeuvres although I wish it was a bit earlier in the afternoon, around 3. There is a smal pool available, which is sufficient. Breakfast is great for us. I love the jam they use! It's a nice quiet spot to sleep. Last time we were in Seattle we used a special deal through a convention we were going to and it was so loud-we were disappointed and will not do it again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Inns in America”
Reviews.Author: ggreen4077
Reviews.Content: Four couples spent the evening at the Inn the night prior to our cruise. This has to be one of the finest B&B’s in the nation. Rooms were large, airy, immaculately clean and well appointed, including a window-balcony overlooking a courtyard and garden, and a fireplace. The evening wine happy hour was generous, with excellent canapés, one of which was so delicious we acquired the recipe. The full breakfast was also excellent with hot and cold food of all types. Staff was courteous, knowledgeable and helpful. What more could one ask? We will always stay at the Inn when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “"WOW" doesn't even do this hotel justice!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_Stidham
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to treat ourselves to nice hotel located close to Pike Place Market and they only thing we really wanted was a Jacuzzi bathtub. We got so much more than that. We got it during a Special Offer time so it was about $100 less than what it normally would (I suggest looking on http://www.innatharborsteps.com/specials.htm for their deals). But I would have paid double for what we got. The service was amazing, very helpful staff, commentary hors d'oeuvre and wine at night, I could go on and on. The location is two blocks away from Pike Place Market, right across the street is the Seattle Art Museum and down the steps were the Piers. The Room itself was incredible. Huge bed with a comfy cover, romantic fireplace, a view of the court yard area and not to mention, the amazing Jacuzzi. Everything about this hotel was warm and inviting. There is not enough good things I can say about this place. My boyfriend and I agreed that they spoiled so much, that there is nowhere else we can stay in Seattle besides here. The only Cons that we could come up with: Parking wasn't free and a little confusing to get to but it was cheaper than parking it somewhere else over night and the staff was very helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: leroybarry
Reviews.Content: Great location,room,staff,food,room 17.We had a great time! Would stay here the ne next time we are in the. City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: taiwanchu
Reviews.Content: Reading previous reviews had as nervous about the service but unless you are needy, the staff are just fine. Rooms are comfy and clean with your own spa bath robes, gas fire place and we stayed in a standard room. Nothing fancy. Comes with breakfast but never partook as Pike's is right there and breakfast should be enjoyed outside your hotel in a food city like Seattle. Wine and cheese was good. Internet slow and intermittent and their wireless was cumbersome to log into so we had the ethernet cable. A bit like an apartment where you can hear loud running people above. Would highly recommend for its central location.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options...”
Reviews.Author: wendypel
Reviews.Content: Our overall impression of the Inn is that it is an afterthought to the apartments. I guess that begins with the fact that the rooms are actually below the lobby - you feel like you are going back to the parking garage. We had a King/Spa room - the highest category. It was large and decently appointed. The fireplace was nice. We had a view of the courtyard - which was fine. But, for what we paid, I would have rather spent $50 more and stayed down the street at Hotel 1000 in one of their Executive Rooms. We found it strange that a boutique hotel wouldn't have wine glasses in the room - and when we called to request them, we were told we could retrieve them ourselves from the breakfast room. The breakfast room reminded my of the common area in a Holiday Inn Express or something of that caliber. Other reviewers are correct in that parking is difficult to navigate - you want directions. You not only get physical keys, but also 2 fobs for the garage and buidling access - it's quite a handful. Do ask for a quiet room - there are a couple that appear to be right under the viaduct exit. And, the heater is annoying as it turns itself on and off repeatedly all night long. All that said, the location at the Steps and near the market was nice. We probably won't stay there again, but it was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: nuck4life
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and loved it from the beginning. Parked our car in the 3 min loading zone, got our keys and I went to park my car while my wife was shown the room. Room was very spacious and clean. Lighting could be a bit better but didnt bother us. Bottled water (Costco brand....love costco) was provided. Bed was comfortable and the fireplace made the room cozy. Afternoon appies were great and so was the breakfast. I did use the fitness room as well as the pool...everything met our expectations from courteous staff to cleanliness and comfort. Would love to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: travellerseattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 20 on the B Level. Everything from the time we made our reservation until the time we checke out was really first class. David, Odessa, Kevin, and the other gal at the front desk whose name I can't recall were all wonderful to us. I had read in previous reviews that noise can be a problem so I called and asked for a really quiet room. Now that I've been there, I don't know how noise could be an issue - the rooms are HUGE and while we were there we didn't hear a peep from anyone else. The front desk told us the hotel was sold-out, but we sure couldn't tell. There is an afternoon wine and cheese time at 4:00. It was a nice little snack - white or red wine, veggies and dip, crackers and cheese and a coconut cake. It went pretty quickly, so if you're going to do it, you should probably be there right at 4:00. There is a breakfast buffet in the morning with egg dishes, a type of potato casserole, fresh fruit, homemade muffins, fresh juices, Irish oatmeal, and tea and coffee. For $5 a person you can have breakfast delivered to your room - that's what we did, and it was well worth it. The bedding is really nice - down comforters and really comfy pillows. The furniture was very comfy - two wing back chairs, and a desk chair plus a really comfy bed. The room was absolutely huge. We had a microwave and a little fridge and lots of counter top space. The bathroom was really lovely - the bath products smelled wonderful and the towels were thick and comfy. One of the nicest things about the room was all the windows - there was a lot of natural light. We had a french door onto a little balcony that looked out onto the lovely garden area. We were within a really easy walk to Pike Place Market and downtown stores. It was fun to just wander around the city and enjoy the area. There is a nice library to enjoy as well as a pool and jacuzzi. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Yes! Great location”
Reviews.Author: MegPortland_Oregon
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and included a fireplace and garden view. Despite the fact that it was very near to a popular and bustling area of the city, the room was quiet. Furniture was a little worn, but the bed was firm. Breakfast consisted of eggs, two ways; grapefruit, grapes and juice; oatmeal and assorted toppings; bread and muffins; coffee & tea. Not the "gourmet" as described nor the standard fare of chain motels. We enjoyed our meal plus the evening reception of wine, crackers, cheese, veggies and cake. With that food we found little need for anything but a large shared salad at dinner. The location is superb: two blocks from Pike St. Market, one block from Seattle Art Museum and a short walk down a few flights of outdoor stairs (the harbor steps) to the waterfront. Give it a try. The only drawback: directions to the inn and into the parking garage were not accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: italgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after seeing an offer for 50% off with Groupon. It is a great location near Pike Place Market. It is actually co-located in an apartment building which made parking, check-in, check-out somewhat complicated and confusing. My husband was a GM for a hotel and we were both in the travel industry for many years. Here are pros and cons: CONS: Check in desk staff sit at low chairs so that you can't see them as you enter the lobby. They don't wear nametags and the blonde who happened to work the Saturday we checked in was what could only be described as "snippy". Perhaps she didn't want to be identified? We seemed to disturb her by asking simple questions such as how to handle the complicated parking situation and when we came back at 2pm to see if the room was ready, were told rather curtly it would be ready at 3PM, no sooner. The room itself was laid out rather oddly. There was an older TV and no DVD player as advertised online. The fireplace was in the hallway. The bathroom lighting was dim. Towels and bathrobes were frayed. The bed was somewhat lumpy and the only pillows provided were small and flat. PROS: Afternoon tea was adequate. The red and white wine in decanters was not very good quality. Cheese was ho-hum generic Costco quality. The morning breakfast was definitely better. Quiche, fruits, cereals and good muffins. If I had paid the full $250 per night for the room, I would have been very upset. As it is, we got a good location and breakfast, but that was really it. The housekeeping standards are not those of a hotel charging those prices.

Reviews.Title: “A dump in the guise of something decent.”
Reviews.Author: HikerGirl101
Reviews.Content: The only notice that you have arrived at the hotel is a small sandwich board sign on the sidewalk. You then have to figure out that it is ok to leave your car in the 3 minute parking space while you roam around trying to figure out that the Inn’s check-in is located in the Harbor Steps Apartment building. Then you get to drive around a few blocks to get into their parking lot. The double queen room was over the supposedly quiet Harbor Steps. 'The Harbor Steps' should not be confused with the Spanish Steps! It is not a pleasant area nor is it quiet and the nearby viaduct traffic is not quiet either. At night, the lights from the Steps area entering the room though the top of the curtains was so bright it lit up the whole room and kept me awake. The bathroom had globs of stuff on the walls and grout in the shower was missing or dirty. The mat in the bath was dirty. There were layers of dust along the edges of the carpet near the bed and cobwebs in the corners. The decor was drab and uncoordinated. Heating and cooling systems are a joke, see photos. The TV was circa 1980s and placed in a location that made it difficult to watch from anywhere in the room. There was no information about local TV channels so if you are there during a weather event, you are on your own. The local magazines and Where mag were months and years out of date. Bring your computer cables as they don't have wi-fi; bring something to carry the bulky fobs and keys you need to get in and out of buildings, and bring a jacket and umbrella. The rooms are located in a building detached from the apartment/check-in/parking building. The hotel is located on the south end of the Seattle Art Museum. If that is your only destination, it is a good location. It is too far from everything else which you realize when you are the only people on the nearby streets after regular business hours. I was afraid to walk alone around here after dark. In a restaurant, if the bathroom is dirty you know the kitchen won’t be clean. I applied that adage here and avoided all their free food which seems to be a big draw. The way too casual front desk seemed much more concerned about telling me their rules than wondering if I needed anything or enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the worst”
Reviews.Author: 85CXPrestige
Reviews.Content: Concierge seldom on duty. Couldn't put in wake up call. Couldn't find anyone when trying to check out. We travel several times a month & always stay in nicer places, but have never been so disappointed as with this place. Location is great & the rooms and amenities are also, but the lack of proper staffing made it the worst experience we have had in years. If you want service from 9 to 5, then a perfect place for you. However, if you expect to be treated as the expense and advertising suggests, then I would recommend you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: WestportMike
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter to the Nutcracker Ballet and spent the night downtown for some fun. The Inn at Harbor Steps was a great location for us as we were able to walk to shops and dining. The staff was very helpful and the room was large and comfortable. It was the third time we have stayed there and will again... the next time something fun lures us to the big city from Westport.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: chrisbigforkmt
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel to be an easy walk to so many attractions that interested us on this trip...pikes market, the seattle art museum, and holiday shopping! our room #20 was enormous--king bed, desk, sitting area, wet bar with frig but no microwave, gas fireplace, large bathroom-- the tiny balcony can't be used for more than a breath of air-- lovely view of lights in the trees from our balcony though! in spite of the location on a busy street, it was quiet by bedtime. tasty breakfast with a few homemake extras like fritatta, cheesy hashbrowns, and cranberry muffins. highly reccommend the restaurant wild ginger for asian food--an easy 3 block walk from this hotel. we took the train from san diego--not a comfortable night's sleep--but loved our few days in seattle and this hotel was perfect for what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: MPMG8r
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Harbor Steps is a good hotel. The staff were friendly and the room was clean and spacious. The hotel's location was close to the Pike St. Market and SAM, and not too far from most of the other attractions in Seattle. Pros: the room was quite large with a small balcony. The hotel provides a free continental breakfast with small extras like french toast and quiche. The best thing about the hotel is its location. The hotel does have a business center for printing boarding passes - but the printer was horribly SLOW. Cons: the room had a faint odor which was only noticed when we entered the room. The room had a feel of a time share - the furnishings were somewhat older / worn. The TV was an old style CRT. You actually receive a metal key to open the door to your room. The iron and ironing board were the cheapest I've ever seen. The room was cooled/heated by a wall unit which seemed under-powered to adequately take care of the large room (the room quite warm at night even though the air conditioner was set to max-cold). The walls are far from sound proof. When our neighbors slid the drapes it sounded like it was in our room. We could hear our neighbors talking and opening/closing their room door. Overall not a bad stay, but I know there are better hotels in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Breakfast/Appies”
Reviews.Author: VicletSmith
Reviews.Content: Confused by the lobby, thought it was only for the apartments, but the lower levels are hotel rooms - clever idea! Friendly staff, if a little too relaxed! But they had great recommendation for Happy Hour - Japonessa - Cheap! In the bar 6-8pm. Otherwise eating out is really expensive. Our first room smelled of smoking in the bathroom, but we were quickly given another room (which had a blocked sink which was never fixed - basement back up problem I think). Room was big. Bathroom huge! Balcony - tiny! Nice fireplace - useful in October! Private room overlooked patio area. Steps and a block down to the waterfront (great area to go for a run). Loved the Crab Pot Feast. Ivar's, Aquarium, Downtown shopping. Fabulous breakfast. Different Frittata every day. Cheesy potatoes. Fresh homemade muffins. Toasts, cereals, Homemade old fashioned oatmeal plus extras (nuts/fruit). Yum! So healthy. Lovely chef! Homemade cookies at reception. Fabulous cheese, crackers, fruit, cake at teatime with coffee/tea. Really bad wine, though, so don't get excited about the 'wine tasting'. The hot tub was cold. Never found the pool, I suspect the 4x8 pool wasn't the actual swimming pool. Had a great time altogether. Great rate $150 a night. We would stay there again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: srtrav
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Seattle,and stayed several nights at The Inn at Harbor Steps. We were very pleased with our accomadatons, and that made our trip that much more enjoyable. We arrived early and were greeted by a very friendly and helpful staff member. She was most helpful in allowing us t leave our luggage with her until our room was ready. When we returned later that fternoon, she showed us to our room and made sure that everything was to our satisfaction. The General Manger helped us to make a reservation for the Victoria Clipper. He also helped us in getting a limo to the airport when it was time to leave. The accomadations and staff helped us to have a memorable trip to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: thump57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Inn at Harbor Steps on a recent get-a-way to Seattle, WA. What a wonderful place. The Inn is in the heart of downtown. Only two blocks from Pikes Market and easy walking to Pioneer Square along with the Pier and other interesting places to go to. David at the front desk is fantastic and will help you with anything you need. They serve a very nice breakfast in the morning and in the afternoon there is cheese and goodies along with wine. The room is very nicely decorated and is very comfortable. I am very picky about beds in a hotel and this one was very nice. We will stay here again when we return to Seattle. We used the light rail from the air port down, $2.50 per person and you arrive 1 block from the hotel. We would recommend Inn at Harbor Steps to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jbnoack
Reviews.Content: excellent inn with large rooms and delicious breakfasts. very close to Pike Place Market and harbor. close to art Museum. Great price for the location if you can find a special! Would recommend to anyone who likes to walk around the city.The only negative is the parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: meisty2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to leaving for our Alaskan cruise. We chose the Inn based on it's location, are we weren't dissapointed! Pike's Place market is an easy 3 block walk, and there are various shops and restaurants nearby. We chose to save money and take the light rail train from the airport rather than a cab. This was super easy and the Inn was only one block from the station. The one-way ride was only $1.50 per person! The Inn itself is located in a building that primarily has upscale apartments, but they have hotel rooms on the lower floors. Our room was very clean and comfortable with a huge bathroom. When David at the front desk learned that we were on our honeymoon he had balloons sent to our room! There was a wonderful free breakfast in the morning, and they have wine and cheese in the afternoon but we were out on the town and missed it. When we checked out we asked David if he would call a cab to take us to the port, but instead he called a private driver who arrived in a Towncar and charged us less than a cab! We had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Seattle Lodging”
Reviews.Author: georgie58
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to Inn at the Harbor Steps in Seattle............great hotel, great location and great service! The breakfast is such a wonderful start to the the beginning of the day and the appetizers and wine offering in the late afternoon offer a very special touch to the ending of the day. All service staff are so friendly and helpful............. a perfect place to stay in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful , Quiet Inn in a GREAT Location in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Car0linaGirl6610
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Inn in walking distance to the main attractions we wanted to see.Only a few blocks to the Waterfront, Aquarium, Pike's Market,Shopping District,Monorail,Museums, and a Liquor and Wine store. The breakfast is the best we had on our trip to the Pacific Northwest and it was FREE to guest.The parking cost was cheap by Seattle standards.We parked our rental car and walked to everything and I had a knee replacement in the Spring. The Inn has an elevator that goes down within one block of the waterfront.We had the best dinner of our trip at Brooklyn's- it was excellent. Take a water taxie at pier 56 to Alki for a good view of Seattle and great food at Salty's and Sunfish. Do the Market early and everyone MUST have some pasteries from The ThreeGirls Bakery-they box to go and my Apple Fritters were wonderful in Vancouver 3 days later.There is a free trolley that runs along the waterfront and the city buses are free to hop on and off in Downtown. Everyone at the Inn was most pleasant, cooperative and helpful, especially Long .Our room was large and very clean, nice large bathroom with a great shower, wonderful bed, wet bar with refrigerator, and even a magnifying mirror in the bathroom. We are so glad we did not stay in a noisy, high rise in the main part of town.We will definitely recommend this Inn and stay here the next time.The best room and the best value of our trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Very central and comfortable Seattle hotel!”
Reviews.Author: candjoshea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I very much enjoyed a three-night stay. The central location of the hotel, the large and elegant rooms; the bountiful breakfasts; and the afternoon wine, cheese and crudites were all excellent. The decor throughout was fine, except for drab carpeting in the corridors. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Where are the four sisters when you need hem?”
Reviews.Author: M-man11
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in previous reviews, we chose Inn at Harbor Steps based not only on the high ratings in TA, but also on visits to other Four Sister properties (i.e. Sonoma, Healdsburg, Yountville, CA). They pretty much all follow the same formula: quaint accommodations (no longer with teddy bears!), afternoon reception, "signature" breakfast, and helpful staff. While we certainly had enough to eat, it wasn't food that is responsible for my low rating. We arrived August 29, 2011, after a week's cruise to Alaska and wanted to spend four more nights in Seattle. The proximity to Pike Place Market and the Seattle Art Museum was the deal maker. We checked in around 1 PM and were told to wait until 3:00 PM, the official time of check-in, but that we could leave our cellphone number to be paged when room was ready. No greeting or welcome. We decided to wait in the lobby tht both the inn and the apartment complex share, with the Sunday Times spread out on the sofa. At a little after two, my wife left to use the facilities, which, we were told, were downstairs where the rooms are also located. On the way back, she happened to pass by room #19, the room assigned to us, and noticed a Do Not Disturb sign posted. There was no cleaning staff anywhere in evidence. I relayed this information to the same receptionist. The same cool treatment continued. She would "look into it." Shortly before three and after abandoning her post at the desk, another employee gave us the keys to another room, one that had been ready all along. No one had bothered to check on our original room assignment. Inside the cavernous room, we found very old furnishings. I had no idea how old they were until trying to sleep on the low, saggy, lumpy bed. The miracle was that neither one of us had any repercussions--no sore back. We managed to sleep fine. The following evening our TV was set to only seven basic channels. Another clerk discovered that "a previous guest must have tampered with the set." When my wife also mentioned the poor bed and tired furnishings, she replied that rooms would be renovated. (Why rent any room that is sub-standard?) But my greatest disappointment came from the many times we sought information or had concerns (i.e. the TV problem). There was simply no one at the desk for ten minutes at a time. Although most of the staff seemed pleasant enough, there was no sign of professionalism. During the afternoon wine and hors d'oeuvres reception, there was no host/hostess to oversee the operation. One just came in and dealt with whatever was left. At $250 a night--no senior discount here--we feel that better standards should be apparent. Perhaps one day that might happen. But until then, we cannot recommend the inn and hope that the Four Sisters management takes a long look at their operations. I should point out that bus transportation is free in zone 1 (right downtown). On one day we took the bus (#22) to Broad Street, walked to the Olympic Sculpture Park, walkrd to the Space Needle, took the Monorail one way to the end of the line, walked back to our inn for only $1.00, the price of the senior ticket to the Monorail. We splurged at the Giorgian in the Fairmont Hotel, three blocks up. Superb service and excellent $49 prix-fixe menu, which included their legendary black and white souffle. We also pulled our suitcases (one each) to the Fairmont to take the Gray Line Express airport shuttle for $15. By all means visit Seattle. If you decide to stay at the Four Sisters Property, do NOT stay in room #10.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: huthoney
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Harbor Steps is conveniently located close to Pike Market, across from the Seattle Art Museum and near the ferries. I liked that the building was not a typical hotel environment. There are only 28 guest rooms. Although it is a large structure, the rest of the building is rented as apartments. There is a pool that is in the adjacent building which I did not see or use. There is a free breakfast available as well as afternoon cheese and wine. I picked this hotel based on reviews I had read online and was extremely satisfied. My husband gave me kudus for a great pick!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: K9pal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to our cruise in August. I picked this particular place based on reviews, and we were not disappointed. We got a great 'senior' rate for a room with 2 queens. We were surprised at how spacious the room was, and with all the amenities - mini fridge stocked with 2 bottles of water, robes, iron/ironing board, hairdryer, coffee maker with coffee and tea, etc. We were a bit disappointed in the small TV that could not be viewed from the nice easy chairs. Balcony was great and had a great view of the harbor, and since it was 80 degrees when we visited the A/C unit was appreciated. Very quiet at night, but we always use earplugs when traveling. Easy walk to Pike Place Market. We took the light rail from the airport to University Station and it was a short walk from there. Breakfast was outstanding in our opinion, but we missed the afternoon wine event. Staff very friendly and accomodating, eager to help us with directions to attractions, food recommendations, and taxi to the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Big Rooms, and Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sdavi
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night here after doing a two week tour from Seattle to Mt. Rainier to Mt. St. Helens to Port Angeles to Victoria to Vancouver and back to Seattle. We got two rooms with two queens beds and each room was bigger than the condo we had in Vancouver. It is located right next to Pike Place and the waterfront. The breakfast was very good (lots of variety and very attentive staff). We got a good deal from Expedia so this inn was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant large rooms but a little tired and odd”
Reviews.Author: pamedavis
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate for downtown Seattle in the middle of summer and I liked the location. The rooms are large, high ceilings, great windows, walls are not paper thin. But...yes, the carpeting seems old and thinning, and there is definite plumbing issues. Tub does not drain, we actually had two rooms, and neither tub drained well and the toilet flusher is sensitive and can fall off. The beds are very comfortable and views are nice, but the a/c is a window unit and can be stuffy and noisy. Coffee and breakfast is not ready until 7:30 and that just seems late, had to run to Tully's coffee shop to get coffee at 7. Also, it is odd that the registration desk is not manned very often. Several times there was just nobody around. And the USA Today, it's not free, you pay .75 for it each day. We weren't asked if we wanted to pay for it since we arrived after 11pm. And the desk person replied with a 'oh, well'. If I got the same rate of $180 a night I would stay again, but would prefer to stay somewhere else, but not pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Impressed...”
Reviews.Author: Debbie0329
Reviews.Content: I thought that this was a fairly pricey hotel...the location is very good! But, bugs in the room, a very hard bed, a so so breakfast, a stain on the bathroom rug, a toilet that actually rocked when flushed, very noisy air conditioning, and a tub that didn't drain all add up...the front desk staff didn't seem to be too concerned about the bugs either!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: lindadol
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel, and we stayed 11 days. Location is the best - can walk or hop a bus to everything. The food was wonderful - breakfast, cookies and happy hour! Staff were helpful and courteous. They gave us water, loaned us an umbrella, gave directions (many times), always with a smile. Room very nice, even had a dvd and fireplace. You will be very happy is you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe really the best place in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: anna_bananav
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a king / spa room and really liked it. The staff was helpful and very friendly. The location really is the best you could stay at while in Seattle. The rooms were big with a nice tub in the bathroom. We also had a fireplace in the living room. The bedroom didn't have a closet but we didn't need one. It was very quiet, too. They have a fitness center you can use and a pool. Both are also used by the people from the apartments. The hotel rooms are on the two lower floors, the private apartments are on the upper floors. Take the elevator all the way up - it has a glass front and gives you great views of downtown - day and night. The breakfast was continental - not a huge selection but well enough and fresh and yummy. We would for sure stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think of staying anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: jangale
Reviews.Content: We visited Seattle for 3 days, arriving by Amtrak. We had booked here based on the reviews. It exceeded our expectations. The location was amazing - we didn't need a car. You can walk to Pikes Market, the monorail, Pioneer Square, restaurants, the ferry boats. Granted, it is a lot of uphill and cobblestones but it was worth it. When we booked, they didn't have a one bed queen available for the first night so we upgraded to a 2 bedroom with a balcony intending to change rooms . The next morning when we went to change keys they nicely said that because the room we were occupying wasn't booked for the next two nights we could stay where we were at the lower rate. The bed was amazing - we both had the best sleeps. \We appreciated little touches like cotton swabs, water bottles in the fridge and morning paper. The breakfast was wonderful! They had 3 hot dishes, bakery bread (raisin bread was amazing!), hot and cold cereals, 4 different kinds of juices, with real dishes & cutlery. They had a chef right there and due to my husbands' food allergies he whipped up scrambled eggs for him - so much we shared. They have a tea/cocktail time at 4:30-6:30 with coffee/tea/wine veggies & fruit & some sort of sweet snack. Anyone we spoke with was very friendly and helpful. It is located in what looks to be a condo/leasing building, they have a shared lobby. You could stay cheaper further out but we only had a couple of days and wanted to be able to be close to everything. We didn't use the pool so I can't comment on that. Also, it rained the whole time so we were unable to use the balcony. The only negative I have is that we had to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Harbor Steps”
Reviews.Author: rwat15inwt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights May 29- June 1, after our criuse to Alaska. When we arrived we were greeted by the very accomodating guys at the front desk. I mentioned that the rooms overlooking the garden we nice, so when our room was ready he moved us to one of these rooms All the staff were excellent and friendly. The room is very large with a couch and sitting chairs when you enter, and then go aroung to the king size bed and very nice bathroom with two sinks and large counter area. The bed was average, but fine for us. Floor A room 8 Let me explain how this place is situated. This is an apartment bldg and they rent out the lower floors that are below the main level. The room are not underground as they sit along a fairly steep incline so the are along the area OFF of the Harbor Steps which are a main pedestrian way to the water 2 bolcks away. It is very quiet at night as this area outside the rooms is closed at night. There is a very nice breakfast served every day. From different egg dishes, potatoes, cereal, fresh fruit, muffins, coffee and oj. etc Changes a little daily. Allen is the cook and does a great job! From 4:30 til 6:30 they put out wine and cheese and some veggies and some kind of cake to munch on in the Library area. Very Nice. There is a small gym, basketball court, lap pool, hot tub and laundry use.. If you want to save some $$$ take the Light Rail from the airport to the University stop and walk ONE block down to !st st and the Inn is right there on the left. $2.50 per person, Yes only two and a half bucks. About $40 bucks for a taxi. Just follow the sign at the airport for the Light Rail, it's about a 5-10 minute walk and its lighted and marked well. It takes 35 minutes to get there. If you need anything there is a small market halfway down the Harbor Steps. I didn't find it till we were leaving though. Lots of places to eat in the area within walking distance. Only about a block from the waterfront, which you can take the elevator down to 1 and avoid the steps if you like. The elevator is kind of across the walkway, just ask the guys at the front desk. It's floor 6 on the way back, which is strange cause it's the ground level. I would recommend the Inn, because the staff was great, the room large and clean, the great breakfast and the afternoon wine and chesse all included. Great location also. A great deal for the price we paid. I have nothing bad to say at all. I would stay there again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at the Steps”
Reviews.Author: rd52
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed another stay here, after taking the Clipper from Victoria to get here. One minor disappointment is that the wine and cheese selection isn't as good and as bountiful as it used to be, but that is a minor quibble. Breakfast was as good as ever. The staff were very helpful. You can't beat the downtown location and its accompanying transit options. We love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Location , location and value”
Reviews.Author: phclub1
Reviews.Content: Just finishing up 3 days in Seattle, at the Inn. This place is located in downtown, 2 blocks from everything. The rooms are great, breakfast included (you don't get this anywhere in downtown). Wine get together at 4:30PM each day, reasonable and easy access parking below. Very attentive front desk, internet acces and computers in lobby for guests. Priced on Pricline was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, friendly, accomodating and centrally located in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Fim1215
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Inn at Harbor Steps was more than accommodating. This was a great, quiet, conveniently located hotel with all the amenities of home. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The only complaint I have was that the room was a bit stuffy but was easily remedied by opening the nice European style windows to let in the fresh, NW air. Close to restaurants, coffee shops, shopping, Pike Place, Post Alley. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location without transportation”
Reviews.Author: elndbutler
Reviews.Content: The Inn is an ideal central location with lots of restaurant and bars within walking distance. We walked to every attraction we had planned to see including the Space Needle. The room was good size and quiet except for Saturday night when you could hear the waterfront partiers, but overall very quiet. Breakfast was free and freshly made every morning by a personal chef which was an unexpected treat. We stayed 5 nights and couldn't beat the price. I recommend eating at The Brooklyn which is one block up from the Inn...fabulous food and great service. We would stay at the Inn at Harbour Steps again and recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, don't bring the kids”
Reviews.Author: beachbummers
Reviews.Content: Wow, I never knew an adult is anyone over 5 years old. That's what this place considers an adult and they charge $25 per child. I guess that covers the breakfast, although what 6 year old can eat $25 worth of breakfast. Nice place though. In the middle of everthing. Parking is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, with charming quirks”
Reviews.Author: Urbanity
Reviews.Content: The staff was gracious and welcoming, breakfast buffet was under-described - it's delicious and the inn dining room is very comfortable for settling into a wing chair to read the paper after breakfast; loved the wine/tea time in the library, a wonderful way for the tootsies and oneself to recover after a day of touring. The room was spotlessly clean, big French window looking out onto the formal private garden, 2 fuzzy towel robes in the closet, and the teddy bear on the bed was a charming addition. There couldn't be a better location for an urban exploration of Seattle: Seattle Art Museum across the street, Pike Marketplace down the handsome Harbor Steps, Aquarium down just a bit farther the steps to Alaskan Way. Pioneer Square a brisk 15 minute walk to the right, 15 minutes beyond that to the International District and the Luke Wing Museum (a must see), and across the street, up the hill, and a few blocks to the left and you're at the marvellous Public Library in downtown and the luxury shopping malls plus the entrance to the Monorail to the Space Needle. The Inn at Harbor Steps is much more like a family-operated B&B than a hotel; the staff leaves around 6 pm and comes in at 7:30 am but the gracious apartment security guard is there. Computer available for printing boarding passes and an excellent Town Car for returning to the airport. Am I staying again? Wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: artsychickVancouver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Inn at Harbor Steps for two nights. It was the perfect location - just steps from the quaint Pike's Market where you can find such interesting boutiques to explore. The hotel was delightful for many reasons. It boasts a quiet and serene atmosphere and beautiful decor. It is very secure and the parking is very reasonable - only $18.00 a night which is unheard of for downtown Seattle! We definitely plan on going back. When we do, we will make sure to call and speak to Long - he was a terrific concierge! He was not only helpful and courteous but he was a plethora of information about Seattle and the surrounding amenties. Thanks for the great stay Long!

Reviews.Title: “Location was great, the rest didn't quite measure up.”
Reviews.Author: esskayess
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. I chose it because of the good reviews and its proximity to Pike Place Market and the Seattle Waterfront. The location proved very useful on that score, especially as a way to avoid finding an overpriced parking space near the aforementioned places (which limit you to 2 hours). On the flipside, $18 a day to park in their garage seems a bit steep. At least there was no valet to take more of my money for parking my car. The room was attractive, clean and comfortable, with a few notable exceptions: Since the “Inn” occupies the two lowest floors (The Harbor Step Apartments and main floor occupy the 20 floors above them.), the room was so close to the “Steps” themselves that we were disturbed by loud passersby and clanking service carts until late that night. The room was also stuffy (especially with the door closed to keep the noise down) and both the air conditioner and ceiling fan were positioned so far from the bed that that they were of limited use. Once the noise died down, we were not disturbed and the bed was reasonably comfortable, though a bit small for a King. The bathroom was elegant and well-stocked and the two “plush robes” provided were nice. The staff was friendly and helpful when called upon, so no complaints there. Other amenities, such as the sauna, gym and hot tub were very useful, but the “free drinks and hors d'oeuvres” they put out in the “library” were underwhelming, especially for non-drinkers, consisting mostly of bland cheeses and odd salads. The complimentary breakfast was much better, featuring a variety of baked goods, breakfast casseroles, French toast and juices. However, only one employee was expected to cook, clean tables and assist guests. He eventually had to call the desk clerk for help and everyone had to wait for more food to be set out. With the rates the Inn charges, they should spend more on help for the two hours breakfast is served. Overall, our experience at the Inn was pleasant, but not five-star, nor quite up to the rate we paid. I’m not saying we won’t return, but other hotels in the area will be considered first.

Reviews.Title: “best breakfast we ever had”
Reviews.Author: ronnieo1
Reviews.Content: would highly recommend this inn. the price was great, the room was great, the location was great, and the breakfast was the best we've ever had in an inn or hotel. david at the front desk was most accomodating and overall we would recommend this inn very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Good value”
Reviews.Author: scoredonu
Reviews.Content: This Hotel begins and ends with its great location. A couple blocks from Pikes Market. A couple blocks from Pioneer Square. During my two night stay, I have great service from the hotel . The rooms are above average but not great. However, the location is why you stay here. Although in full disclosure, it is a few blocks from two adult peep shows. However, so is the Four Seasons. Only negative, and this is a small one is my room was by one of the entrance doors. And I had to listen to the scan key beep every time someone came in. No matter how late. But again very minor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room -- huge with great, private layout of beds; balcony”
Reviews.Author: dcooper_10
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing about the hotel is how hard it is to actually find the entrance. Signage is so discreet that it is possible to ride up and down elevators and circle the block, looking for the entrance. However, that aside, it really is a great hotel right across the street from the Seattle Art Museum and quick walk to Pike Place Market. We walked to Purple and to Wild Ginger also. The room itself, with two queen beds, has a staggered layout so it is not possible to see one bed from the other. The bathroom looked as if it was about to be updated (spackle on the wall) and that would be good because the tub drained slowly and the shower was not strong. Minor things for a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mobile_Mirandas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our 3rd anniversary, and the room was very nice and comfortable, but the location we great. You're right across the street from the Seattle Art Museum (SAM), and a few blocks south of Pike Place. The room itself was large and well situated - and the bath soaps/amenties were amazing. But, as other reviews have mentioned, little things in the bathroom were off - the laminate trim was missing on part of the cabinet and the faucets were loose (not enough to be a problem, but for the price that should be fixed). The wine and cheese were a nice treat, and surprisingly the complimentary breakfast was quite good. They had a chef there that could make hot egg dishes for you, and the selection was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: chala1
Reviews.Content: I chose the Inn at Harbor steps for it's location for a trip to Vancouver Island and the Olypic peninsula coming from germany. We arrived early in the evening, and we were stunned when we saw, how big the room actually was. It was only for one night, so we took our spare baggage to the reception, we had to leave quite early the next morning, so we could not taste the breakfast. Whewn we came back two weeks later, the baggage, we had left here, was already brought to our room...( never experienced anything like that before!) The breakfast really has a nice toich, not the "anywhere the same" breakfast., although my husband missed some ham or meaty stuff... the location is absolutely perfect, just minutes from that wonderful market, across the street from the Art Gallery... , the Aquarium, shops, Pioneet Sqaure... A nice touch is also the free lemonade on the reception counter and the cookies. Not bad, when you come from an intercontinetnal flight, I am always drained out and a welcoming sip of refreshment is a nice touch!. What I also did like was a small questionaire, where we were asked forn outstanding servise experienced at other hotels.... I daresay that few other hotels of this kind and price range offer better service..!!! We would definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: mgptravels
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Seattle. Wonderful time. The location of the Inn is perfect. We were able to walk almost everywhere. Were able to stop back to drop off packages or enjoy the wine/snacks before heading off to dinner. Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were spacious. We will definitely return to the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location for exploring Seattle”
Reviews.Author: TwoWheelExplorer
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the Inn at Harbor Steps. Recently stayed there while on a bike tour of Washington and loved it. The location is perfect - just steps from Pikes Place Market and the waterfront and close to public transportation. The new light rail from the airport drops you off two blocks from the hotel. The room was great, but because the Inn is part of a larger apartment complex, the amenities were even better. Great breakfast buffet, afternoon wine and snacks, computers with Internet access, movie nights, hot tub, gym, basketball court, and even free use of a laundry room. I would definitely recommend the Inn at Harbor Steps to anyone staying in Seattle, especially those traveling without a car.

Reviews.Title: “One Day In Seattle”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloLizard
Reviews.Content: We recently went on an Alaskan Cruise and decided to stay one day post cruise in Seattle. Without a rental car we decided to find a good location and spend our time walking for the day. We stayed at The Inn at The Harbor Steps and found we were only 2 blocks from the Pikes Place Market. Spent the morning at the market before it became very busy; then crossed over a bridge and walked to The Seattle Aquarium. Fantastic time at both places. After the aquarium we walked down the piers and went on an Argossy Harbor Cruise that was very intersting. Then onto Ye Olde Curiosity Shop for some browsing. Late lunch at Joes Bell Diner right next to the waterfront. Excellent food and service. Back to the Inn at the Harbor Steps. Our room was beautiful and we had an invitation to a Happy Hour in the library. Wine and cheese; fruits for a few hours. Met many nice people also staying at the Inn. Back onto the streets for more sightseeing in Pioneer Square and then back to the waterfront for a late dinner. Excellent breakfast included at the Inn. They also arranged for a town car to take us to the airport for less than what a cab would have cost. Would do this all again. Wonderful day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Mitch627
Reviews.Content: Since I have always been a huge fan of the Four Sisters Inns, I immediately thought of Harbor Steps when I started planning my trip to Seattle. While the other locations are actual inns, this location is part of an apartment complex and although it lacks some of the quaint charms of the other properties that I have stayed in while in California, it was a nice place to stay. The biggest draw to this property is the location. It is a 5 minute walk to Pike's Place where we spent quite a bit of time shopping, eating and having cocktails. It is also a 2 minute walk to the Harbor, Elliot Bay Shops and the Ferries to Bainbridge Island. The rooms were spacious and clean and the people at the front desk were very accomodating suggesting restaurants, directions and potential itineraries for the day. I would definitely recommend the inn to anyone going to Seattle. It is a short walk from the famous Inn at the Market but it is half the price so if you are looking for a great location, this is a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect downtown location”
Reviews.Author: sunbird1521
Reviews.Content: Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Large, clean, pretty room complete with fireplace. Wonderful pillows. Loved the door to the balcony which could be left open at the top for fresh air. Bathroom has everything you need. Plenty to choose from, both hot and cold, at breakfast and very tasty. Within walking distance to tourist attractions and on the bus line for others.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect respite with all the amenities!”
Reviews.Author: ginnybrown
Reviews.Content: With the tripadvisor reviews so positive, we chose the Inn At Harbor Steps on 1st Ave.for our first trip to Seattle before embarking on a cruise to Alaska. What a great choice!! Not only is it a stone's throw away from the pier, Pike's Market, the aquarium and dozens upon dozens of restaurants and coffee shops, it's spacious and comfortable. Our room was complete with a fireplace, evening chocolates, robes, coffee/tea maker, and a frig that had complimentary bottled water. It's more personable like a B&B, with the looks of a hotel. The breakfast was served in a dining room for guests only and we were surprised at the variety and freshness of it all.....fresh fruit, juices, egg dishes, breads, pastries, oatmeal, dry cereals, yogurt........we wanted for nothing. There were 16 in our group and everyone loved it. One of our friends booked the gym for two hours one evening to play some basketball, while others had free access to the pool, hot tub, and exercise rooms.
