There was cool, orange water as we arrived and freshly made cookies. The beds were comfortable and I think the entire group slept well, despite some noise issues with some of the a/c. The monorail was located a short walk toward city center which took us to the Space needle within minutes. Next door to the Inn was a Brazilian Restaurant that we were dying to try after we reviewed the menu, but we just ran out of time. We did have time though for the coffee shop two doors away with the most amazing strawberry scones!! The easterners that we were, we'd be up very early and go walking before breakfast and this coffee place held us over until the real breakfast! The restaurants are so close. Several of our group tried the Crab Pot on the water and loved it, as did the rest of us who chose to try the different chowders at various places...Seared scallop chowder, clam chowder, corn chowder.....every one was better than the rest. Every Friday, the large steps 'Harbor Steps", adjacent to the hotel that descends to the pier, hosts a musical group and that was a nice place to sit and relax after all the walking. Can't forget to mention the place on 1st street just south of the Pike's Market........the window is a showplace for the hundreds of chocolate and caramel covered apples. At $8.00, you may think it's a bit pricey, but we shared a rocky road concoction (easy to do because they cut it all up for you!) that was heavenly. All in all, our hotel choice made all of the difference because it gave us such great access to the city highlights. We would definitely stay at the Inn @ Harbor Steps again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place!”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl50
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Seattle and stayed at this wonderful Inn. The rooms were very comfortable , homey and at the same time luxurious. A hot, fllling, and delicious buffet breakfast is included and they serve complimentary wine and appetizers in the "library" every afternoon. The desk staff was very helpful and the location was within walking distance of everything we wanted to do, such as, Pikes Market, Space Needle, great restaurants and the harbor . It was a find for sure and our entire group had nothing but great things to say about staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Garfster_SE1
Reviews.Content: I emailed the reservation to the Inn at Harbor Steps and after a week of waiting for a resonse decided to contact their head office. An apologetic email eventually came back together with confirmation of booking. I also requested an early check-in but on our arrival at 10am after an overnight train journey we were not even provided with a room in which to freshen up. The hotel is part of a much larger apartment complex and is very strangely set up, sharing its facilities with the apartments but having its own separate reception desk tucked away in a corner. To get from reception to your room you have to go outside, across an open walkway, down an external staircase or in a public access lift which can be operated only with a key – in fact, you are given no less than 3 keys!!!! The room was standard US hotel but had a pleasant enough balcony overlooking the harbour (yes, there's a 'u' in harbour) steps and the monstrosity of the waterfront elevated highway. Service was courteous but rarely more than than, breakfasts are served in a windowless room somewhere in the basement but a more pleasant afternoon happy hour (with unlimited wine and nibbles) can be enjoyed in the library. Where this hotel does score highly in my book is its location, diagonally opposite the Seattle Art Gallery, 5 mins from Pike Street Market, 2 mins from the waterfront and perhaps a 10 min walk from Pioneer Square. Otherwise, it was a bland ‘corporate’ feel hotel that has to be ranked last of all the hotels we stayed in during our 3 week tour of the US and Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: RbrtH
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Inn at Harbor Steps? It's incredible!!! Beautiful and comfortable accommodations within walking distance of all the downtown Seattle destinations. Walk to the ferry, to Pikes market, to the Monorail, to hundreds of restaurants and coffee shops of every variety. The complementary breakfasts at the Inn are great. If you are there in cool weather, make use of the in-room gas fireplaces. There is free-high-speed internet in the rooms, and in the "library." There is also a very nice complementary reception in the library each evening with wine, cheese, and fruit. There's a pool, gym, and exercise room for your use as well! The downside... A place of this caliber needs to have in-room safes!!!! Most people these days travel with laptops and other electronics, and a hotel should provide a convenient in-room place to secure them. Harbor steps doesn't! (There is a safe-deposit box at the front desk, but that is hardly convenient!) My other complaint... it would be great if there was a way to access the parking garage and elevators before you have checked in. There is really no place to park for check-in... and if you park in their parking garage you can't get to the elevator that takes you up to check-in without a security fob, which you don't get till check-in!!! Very awkward. If there is an easy way around this, I haven't found it. Having said that... Harbor Steps is our favorite place to stay in the Seattle area. We've stayed there a number of times, and will probably stay many more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this place is Great!”
Reviews.Author: lipnmin
Reviews.Content: This was a gem to find! This place is so nice and in the heart of town. Loved the spacious rooms, free breakfast and 4pm tea in the libary. If you are going to Seattle, this is a must stay at hotel. The only negavite things are that its hard to find from the directions and the parking is costly. But if you know that ahead of time, then no biggy!

Reviews.Title: “Dated Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: swimmingtheworld
Reviews.Content: This a prime piece of real estate, but the hotel does not try very hard, especially for the price. Pros: large rooms, comfortable beds, pleasant lobby, swimming pool, work-out room. Cons: dated floral, plaid decor in rooms with too many knick-knacks and NO safes. For $250+ per night that's unacceptable, even though one may inconveniently leave valuables for lockup at the front desk. Bathrooms need updating. Complimentary afternoon hors d'oeuvres are served, as is a breakfast buffet with weak coffee (in a great coffee town!), salty eggs, paper-dry oatmeal, and fresh fruit that ran out well before meal time was over. The overworked breakfast cook also baking cookies there in the kitchenette said he had no more fruit, and clearly was too busy to go find any. There are better places to to stay in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: celebrating35yrs
Reviews.Content: Our stay of almost a week was wonderful! The amenities and staff were outstanding. The breakfast layout was delicious and plentiful. Also, the wine and cheese hour was relaxing and a very nice treat! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: DAKBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel before and after taking a cruise to Alaska out of Seattle. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very helpful. The Inn is lovely and the location is excellent (a block from Pike Place Market and a short walk to the waterfront.).The breakfast and the wine and cheese in the library in the afternoon were delicious and are a nice bonus! We will definitely stay there when we visit Seattle again

Reviews.Title: “This was a great beginning and end to our Alaska cruise.”
Reviews.Author: jubo44
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay a night in Seattle at both beginning and end of our Alaska cruise and chose the Inn. We loved everything about it. The staff was friendly and willing to help with all our needs; the rooms were large and well appointed; the location was perfect for what we wanted to do in Seattle! We would definitely stay here again on a trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: dalo2
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. Outstanding location with a European feel. Room was charming, spacious and quiet. The added hotel amenities like afternoon wine/tea were very nice. We were sorry we weren't staying longer. We would definately stay here again when in Seattle,

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay overnight before a cruise; get off to right start on vacation.”
Reviews.Author: clickner
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of the Four Sisters B&B's in both CA and WA. Always a fine experience. We have been taking cruises out of Seattle and always spend the night before at the Harbor Inn at the Steps. The location is great (we used to live in Seattle, and when we did we stayed at the Widbey Island location). The afternoon appetizers and wine is just the nicest thing, as well as the morning breakfast. The exercise room and hot tub area at the Harbor Inn are used by us. The two block walk to Pike Market Place is great as is the walk across the street to the Art Museum. We have made another reservation for 05/10 for our next cruise out of Seattle. Eric Larson

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed in ...in a long time and staff that are truly NICE and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: LaRueSanDiego
Reviews.Content: What a surprise. Don't know where to start. Definitely five star . The service from the front desk to maids etc was like having a personal butler. The room was awesome with a fireplace, ceiling fan , nice bed, a huge living area to sit and read or work at a desk. Nice homey touches and nick knacks inthe room. Breakfast each AM by a gourmet cook was included in the price( Quiche, muffins, sweet cakes, scones, chessy hashbrowns, oatmeal with all the fixings). Also had a happy hour each day in the "library", fruit, cheeses and red and white wine, again included in the stay for free. A superb bang for the buck! Oops...also had internet and wireless in rooms, a hot tub, pool .and resistance pool and nivce fitness room!

Reviews.Title: “tremendous deal for prime downtown”
Reviews.Author: Tassajara12
Reviews.Content: A good room at Harbor Steps can be obtained from Seattlesupersaver for $150/night including parking and breakfast. This is an unbeatable deal. The inn is immediately across the street from the museum of art and 2 blocks from Pikes Place. Post Alley ends at Harbor Steps, so you don't even have to walk down 1st - although who would want to miss the signage at Lusty Lady ("Check out our Stimulus Package"!!!). Rooms are huge and light , with balconies. Some have as nice a view of the harbor as any Seattle hotel would - and our experience has always been to ask for a better room than originally assigned. The rooms are well soundproofed. Service is excellent - and most desk staff are more than happy to help with any question you might have. Breakfast is OK - fresh fruit, muffins, some hot dishes (so-so). Free Seattle Times thrown at your door (hard) at 7 AM. The nagatives: since this is a condo complex, you'll get about 6 keys and fobs to variously open the doors, work the elevator, enter and leave the garage, etc. I'm sure that the arrangement that Four Sisters has with the Harbor Steps Apartments requires this absurdity, but hopefully the place will go electronic at some point (it IS Seattle, afterall). The rooms are becoming tired and need to be refreshed. The whole complex has the look and feel of an 80s swinging singles condo complex - and the rooms of the Inn are interspersed among generic, disinfectant-smelly, metal-door hallways of the complex. You can ignore this, hopefully. Decor in the rooms was not particularly well thought out - and includes towel racks, tissue holders, etc that are just screwed into the drywall - and hence, loose. Windows are usually dirty. No WiFi (in SEATTLE!!), but ask for a cable. Old TVs. Dinged up paint and furniture. Drains are commonly slow. However, our experience is that the rooms are reasonably clean and available on time or even early. They are pleasant and clean enough to enjoy. The views, hugh size, and balcony definitely make up for any lapses, particularly for the $150.00 price!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and great value near all the sites of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Travelingtwin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Inn at Harbor Steps a number of times and it never ceases to amaze me! I had booked only one night and upgraded to a larger room with a king bed and fireplace. The room was HUGE, bathroom very large, a little sink and refrigerator area, two large french doors with windows above and a lovely sitting area next to the fireplace. The room was two stories tall! I was visiting my son who lives in Seattle and immediately slipped on my robe, grabbed the teddy bear off the bed (my husband couldn't join me!) and settled in with the many magazines in front of the fire. The views from the room are out to a quiet courtyard garden and you literally walk up one flight of stairs and through the front door and you are out in busy, bustling downtown Seattle. One and a half blocks away is Pike's Market and many other shops, sites, waterfront near the hotel. They also offer a generous hor d'oeuvre, wine selection in the library right down the hallway in the afternoon as well as a full course breakfast with yummy quiches in the morning as part of the room rate. I would not stay any where else and I have stayed at many properties in Seattle and this one by far is the very best. The front desk is very nice and accommodating also. Parking is reasonable with full in and out privileges and the best thing is you park your own car and don't have to wait for a valet. Try this place out - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: thesheck
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel to us. While we loved the location, we didn't think it was worth the price tag. The much touted wine and cheese was sub par in a "library" of falling down books. The breakfast was mediocre. Our room was spacious but poorly laid out with no where to put our things. All in all, it seems like this was once a nice hotel but today, it is on the verge of shabby.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at Harbor Steps is Getting Tired”
Reviews.Author: GeoAntrobis
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed at the Inn. The first time was shortly after it had opened. Subsequent visits leave the impression that not much has been done to keep the rooms updated. We noticed that the towels, while not threadbare, could stand to be replaced. The bathroom baseboard abutting the bathtub was goobered up with caulk. A toilet plunger was conveniently provided next to the toilet in it's own plastic bag (good thing, it was required due to the anemic flushing action). The toilet paper dispenser was barely attached to the wall. Granted, small things, but they all add up. I would agree with the reviewers who commented that finding the entrance and then finding the parking garage, and then finding the correct spaces in the garage present challenges. However, during this stay, the desk clerk was very helpful, not only with directions but also with all other inquiries. Despite the superb location, (almost across the street from the art museum, and within blocks of Pike Street Market and Benaroya Hall) for future visits we will consider downtown lodging that offers better value.

Reviews.Title: “The secont time was even better.”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetical
Reviews.Content: Brought friends with us on this return visit and they loved it as much as we did. Large (600 sq ft +), well-furnished, comfortable room. Helpful staff. Full breakfast that changes each day. Handy to most everything downtown. When I called to reserve they told me about a "second night free" offer which made things even better. The Ipanema Grill next door makes dinner easy, if you're a carnivore.

Reviews.Title: “There's some value to this stay”
Reviews.Author: arlenejoe
Reviews.Content: This apartment-style hotel is a very good value - great location two blocks from Pike Market and by the water, spacious and attractive rooms, good towels and firm mattresses, fresh cookies and afternoon tea with wine and cheese. There's even continental breakfast. It is a little odd in that there are, indeed, apartments that are also managed by the company that runs this small chain. There's a gym and sauna, many restaurants close by, and access to plenty to do. Oh, and soda and water are complimentary, as is Internet access. There are a few negatives, but these would be weighed against the very-reasonable nightly rate. The drapes are not hung correctly so they are hard to close, the shower's water pipes creak horribly loud, maintenance was vacuuming the hallway at 8 in the morning, the walls are a bit thin, and front desk is anything but friendly (one gets the feeling that they just don't like their jobs - too bad). Are these reasons not to recommend this place? Probably not, given the convenient location, attractiveness, and extra amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: prenloe
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night at the Inn at Harbor Steps with my fiancee and loved the experience. 1. The hotel staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They escorted us (and our bags) to our room and found the toiletries that I had accidentally left at home. 2. The suite was nicely decorated and offered a number of luxuries at an affordable price. The suite we stayed in had a gas fireplace and a large, jetted bathtub. 3. The walls were a bit thin, but our neighbors weren't making too much noise. Overall, I had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend this hotel to any couple wanting to get away for a night or weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed998
Reviews.Content: I did not expect a Residence Hotel. To start off the parking is terrible. You need four separate security devices or keys to get into your room, parking etc. The bathroom walls were yellow streaked from steam and dust hung from the door header. The artificial plants on the bed night stands had not been washed or dusted in years. The "beautiful breakfast" is a buffet style served in a basement room. Uck. We walked to a nice restaurant for breakfast. For the money I would stay in Bellevue or another uptown hotel. I will not go back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: slipknotsunshine
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent! 2 blocks from Pike, several excellent restaurants nearby, really neat view of the Harbor Steps during the day; same view of the Harbor Steps at night is random drunk or deranged people napping on the steps, and my morning was jarred a bit when I stepped out on the balcony to be greeted by the sight of one of the same relieving himself into the fountain. Check-in: A little disconcerting. There is no clear sign of the Inn, just of Harbor Steps apartments. We called the hotel and the front desk guy said they were the same thing, and proceeded to rapid-fire instructions for pulling up in the loading zone outside the apartments, come and check in, get a wad of keys including two sensors, and get incorrect directions for driving two more blocks, turn right, and fumble your way through the parking garage with one or more of the sensors, which didn't work. Luckily, we made it back to the lobby and the same clerk walked us to the room and fumbled with the key for the elevator, then the key for our room, explaining the entire time that "this is a private building". We had a much easier time getting access to everything than he did. Room: Beautiful! Oversized with decent linens, workspace, big closet, and nice bathroom with good amenities. Loved the simple touches that make all the difference, like the DVD player (movies available in the lobby) and complimentary soft drinks in the fridge. The shower was interesting; curtain so dense that stepping into the shower was like stepping into a dark cave, and I had to partially bent to get my head wet (I'm 5'7"). Surprised that towels weren't of better quality. Decor in the room was pretty tired and kind of 1950's style, with generic prints of flowers and fruit that could have been purchased at Wal-Mart. Room service was impeccable, everything was perfectly clean and we had more towels than we needed, which was very nice. It bugged me that there was no comfortable place to watch TV; one bed was too far away to see it comfortably, and the other bed was off to the side. There was also a ridiculous amount of noise from other rooms, I suspect due to a lack of insulation in the walls. We could've jumped into our neighbors' conversation at any time, every word was crystal-clear. Overall, it was a good stay; we didn't interact much with the staff, and when we did we felt as if they were being courteous, but nothing more. They were surprisingly uninformed about restaurants and nightlife beyond the Brazilian restaurant next door (not worth the money) and the techno clubs the 21-ish age group frequents. At check-out we got a nice send-off with a promotional offer for returning guests, and will probably take advantage of that offer and stay at the Four Sisters on Whidbey Island next time. All in all, for the price we were quite satisfied but would keep other options in mind for when we return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location, Lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: juliebug52
Reviews.Content: The room was nice. An oasis on 1st Avenue. Breakfast was wonderful, the wine and cheese in the afternoon was great, free sodas in the fridge and cookies at checkin. I loved this place and would come back. If you have a car you need to stop out front and do a semi-checkin. They give you a keycard for the parking garage and a fob to opent the door to the elevator. You drive two blocks, take a right, take the next right and drive back the two blocks to enter the garage on the backside of the property. Park near the elevator they tell you to park near. Your fob opens the door to the elevator. You go up the elevator back to the lobby and they show you to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: t10splyr
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Seattle and stayed at the Inn and I am here to tell you, the Inn is incredible. Our room was spacious and elegant - decorately very nicely (French style) with a separate cozy sitting room, fireplace and large bathroom. This is not your typical hotel room which we found very refreshing. The afternoon complimentary wine/cheese/cakes in the library is a must - a great way to break up your day. Breakfast is ok but then I am not a breakfast person. The staff is friendly, courteous and helpful. The location is within walking distance to most of the Seattle sights - Pike's Market, harbor restaurants, downtown shops, Pioneer Square, etc. Not to mention, SAM (Seatte Art Museum) is right across the street. I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting/exploring Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming!”
Reviews.Author: Nikita50
Reviews.Content: A charming get away right in the city. This B&B occupies the lower floors of a high rise apartment complex located across the street from the Seattle Art Museum and just a few blocks from the Pike Street Market. The breakfast was fresh with a variety of foods, prepared by a pleasant cook. You can have your morning cup of coffee outdoors on your balcony or in the lush garden just outside the breakfast room door. The early evening wine/cheese reception in the library was a nice relaxing touch. Our room was enormous and very clean. My only criticism (and it indeed is small) is the lack of lighting. The room was outfitted with several table lamps and one floor lamp, but no overheads. This might be fine for young eyes, but it was a challenge to put my lipstick on straight. The location is great - you can easily walk to the Market and the waterfront and to the Space Needle (about 30 mins). I recommend the Inn for couples or for a girls weekend.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is "GREAT"”
Reviews.Author: Klextra
Reviews.Content: Inn at Harbor steps combines a great price, with a huge room, in a perfect location for visitors, with a wonderful breakfast. I took the Airporter shuttle for $11 from SEA to the Fairmont, just three blocks away...three downhill blocks, I should note. The lobby also serves the apartments housed in the same building. Very modern, clean with efficient and friendly service at the desk. My room was in the building separate from the main building. No problem, its just across the courtyard. The room is really a one bedroom apartment. It is well furnished, including free sodas and water in the 'fridge. The bed was quite comfy. A small balcony looked over the harbor steps. The location is a couple of blocks from Pike Place Market, or a walk down the steps to the piers, with their restaurants and wares. One must walk uphill to the malls of downtown or the convention center, so if you are a conventioneer, this may not be for you. If you walk down to Pike, and go up the milder hills on that street, you will get to the monorail fairly easily. The mono takes you to Seattle Center with the Space Needle and the museums, particular the Experience Music Project museum, witch is VERY much worth the visit. The breakfast is "home style", more like what I would get from hotels in Italy. A couple of kinds of eggs, baked and quiche. Pastries, bagels, toast, cereal and the like. Good coffee. Anyway, this a cool and comfy place for a stay in Seattle. I'd recommend it to everyone (except conventioneers.)

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: di143
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out everything was top notch. Even though we arrived several hours before our check in time, due to our flight, the front desk gave us our room information and took our cell phone number so they could call us if our room was ready early. About an hour later we got a call to let us know we could check in. This is excellent customer service! The location is right in the middle of the Pike Market and Pioneer Square. You walk right down to the water side restaurants, it's perfect. Our room was more like a studio apartment. Beautifully decorated, well appointed with all the amenities. We had a garden view corner room with a fireplace, jetted tub and a good bed. There is a wine and cheese afternoon mixer and a delicious breakfast prepared by a talented staff that you meet in the breakfast room. You will be very happy if you choose to stay here when you are in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Ritz Carlton!”
Reviews.Author: missjudy43
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the best hotel in which we have ever stayed. Not only are the rooms beautifully decorated, incredibly comfortable and wonderfully accented, the staff couldn't be more helpful and accommodating. The amenities (refrigerator and coffee maker, free soda, free full breakfast, afternoon tea) are beyond great! The location is superior, only two blocks off the harbor. A beautifully done, sophisticated hotel/inn which rivals the very best of them! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a wonderful experience in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a wedding party”
Reviews.Author: FallsRiver
Reviews.Content: We were in town for our daughter's wedding and found Harbor Steps to be perfect for what we were looking for. Big, comfortable rooms, common areas where we could meet up with other members of the wedding party, and a central location for exploring Seattle. This place was just right. The service at the front desk was very good, however, some of us had housekeeping issues - a couple of times the rooms weren't made up until mid afternoon. Another minor complaint was the quality of their towels - pretty rough. It was a very busy week - this Inn provided a quiet oasis where we could relax and get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “This Inn was OK, not great”
Reviews.Author: msshushu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an OK place to stay. i called originally asking if there was internet in the rooms and was told there was. i got there, and the only internet they had was like a business centre type setup. the rooms are ok, not spectacular. the location is fun though. hope that helps someone, don't stay here if you need internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the center of downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: deliot01
Reviews.Content: Our family had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The rooms were very comfortable, clean, and cozy. Our rooms had a fireplace and each night we had turn down service. The staff was very helpful and polite. The breakfast buffet was terrific and every day there was a wine and cheese reception which was a very nice touch. We thoroughly enjoyed our vacation here!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad room”
Reviews.Author: B_BAtlanta_7
Reviews.Content: The location, common areas, & service are nice, but the room we had was disappointing. Dim lighting & an air conditioning unit that sounded like a jackhammer were disappointments. We stayed in room #3.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: GrosseGlatze
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy with our room, especially for the discounted price we paid. Very spacious and comfortable, with a very large bathroom. Wonderful breakfast, with different hot dishes prepared each day. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Most Seattle attractions are walkable from the hotel, although the hotel is within Seattle's "free zone" on the Metro line. The quality of the amenities seems to be related to the fact that most of this facility consists of condos and only the 28 or so hotel rooms. Some reviews referred to it as being like a B&B; it's really not. It just has a smaller, cozier feel to it. We stayed in larger, more "luxurious" (overpriced) hotels on our trip to Seattle>Victoria BC>Vancouver BC, but this one was our favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Inn!”
Reviews.Author: cooper51
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in Seattle for a wedding from July 16-20 and we booked 6 rooms for our stay. We stayed at the Harbour Steps several years ago and since we stay at Four Sisters Inns often, we felt comfortable in booking our relatives there. Honestly, it could not have been better. The rooms were large, comfortable and clean. We especially liked the complimentary drinks in the mini-bar. Breakfast was delicious, as always. The best part about the stay however, was the staff at the front desk. David in particular was especially helpful and was always willing to help during a very busy time for us. Equally friendly was Christine. Both are an asset to this charming, well-situated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, A+++ to the staff”
Reviews.Author: NanaSue22
Reviews.Content: We chose the Inn at Harbor Steps for our time in Seattle after an Alaskan cruise. We stayed 3 nights and it was a delightful experience. We were given room #7 and it was like being in a tree house. The room itself was very large with at least 15' ceilings. The bathroom was the largest I've ever seen in a hotel and the small kitchenette with a great bonus. Especially the complimentary cokes in the frig. Our room overlooked the courtyard area and was just steps away from the breakfast room. The staff was so helpful. We would tell them where we wanted to go and they would printout which busses to take to get to our destination. Pikes Street Market was only 2 blocks away and the waterfront was just an elevator ride down to the right level and two blocks over. The only problem we had was using the air conditioner. It was at floor level and right next to one of the night stands. We had to practically stand on our head to adjust it. We definitely would return to this hotel. Everyone was courteous and helpful and the room was quiet and very comfortable. M.S.D.

Reviews.Title: “More Bang for Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: rangerSanAntonio_TX
Reviews.Content: We chose the Inn at Harbor Steps because it is without doubt the best location in downtown Seattle, midway betwen Pikes Place Market and Pioneer Square, and two blocks from the waterfront. Yet besides location, the facilities are the best, the service complete, and the breakfast superb. You get more bang for your buck at the Inn at Harbor steps than any other place in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: bikerider23
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Harbor Steps is located just 2 blocks up the hill from the Seattle waterfront, and was a nice oasis in the middle of downtown. Once the hotel was located and bags unloaded (somewhat difficult to do due to one-way streets and no on-street hotel parking), the check-in was nicely done and we were taken to a very spacious room. Outside was a nice tree and plant filled area with steps leading down towards the water front. The hotel is across the street from the Art Museum and right next door to a Brazilian meat-lovers restaurant. Also, the Pike Street Market is only 2 blocks north. Overall, this was a very nice place to stay, maybe slightly spendy but the location and unexpected garden-like setting made it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “A charming place in Seatte”
Reviews.Author: cmo03LU
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 2 night stay at the Inn at Harbor Steps. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in Seattle that is close to Pike Place Market. Great breakfast! Cookies at checkin. Excellent wine and cheese snack in the evening! Access to workout room, sauna and pool too! Very comfortable and large enough room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's all”
Reviews.Author: Lilliputian308
Reviews.Content: We were given, as an anniversary gift, a stay the Inn at Harbor Steps in supposedly the best, and hence most expensive, room they had. It had a separate king bed room , a fireplace in the living room and a jacuzzi tub. However, we did not stay in this room for more than one night becuase it was dirty, falling apart, very dark and because we felt unsafe. This room was on the bottom floor of the inside atrium and the patio doors (well there was no patio so that was strange) did not lock. At night homeless people slept or walked around that atrium and we did not feel comfortable with that. The room was so dark that it was impossible to shave or put on makeup very well in addition to being very depressing and there was zero view to look at. So, the second day, after much ado and a few wasted hours later, we were transferred to a 2 bedroom queen in an entirely other part of the hotel. This part was in the tower that has mostly apartments in it and the hotel has a few rooms that they rent out. We enjoyed this room much more although it still wasn't all that clean. I had "something" (perhaps vomit?) running down the side of one of the bedside tables and the carpeting needed to be replaced etc. We really enjoyed the view from the big patio (complete with table and chairs) overlooking the harbor steps. Since we were some floors up, safety was not an issue as it was in the other building. The location of this hotel however is excellent! You are able to walk to many locations of interest. Parking in their parking garage is a challenge and a bit of a pain (we encountered many hotel guests walking around lost) but it's doable. We were really disappointed overall with this hotel except for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this Inn!”
Reviews.Author: juleskTucson
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Harbor Steps was a great find. Perfect location, well appointed rooms, extremely friendly and helpful staff. We had never visited Seattle before, but by the time we left, David and his staff made us feel like long valued friends. We walked everywhere from this centrally located property. The morning breakfasts were hearty and healthy! Please consider this Inn when planning your trip to this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Studio69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights in two separate rooms on a recent Spring Break trip to Seattle. This was a return trip for us as we stayed here in November 2001 and I guess it left a good impression upon us because I checked no where else for this trip. I have very fond memories of this hotel as I watched on TV game 7 of the World Series between the Arizona Diamondbacks against the Yankees. The walls must be very well insulated as we had no complaints to my very loud cheering, especially when Luis Gonzales hit the game winner in the bottom of the 9th inning. Anyway we stayed in Room 20 the first night and would highly recommend it as it was quiet, huge, and well decorated. We found the room clean. Front desk was efficient, but not bubbly happy that we returned, but I didn't need that. Location is prime time 2 blocks from Pike Street Market and catty corner to the Seattle Art Museum which we took in this trip. We had been advised to take mass transit--city bus-- from the airport to downtown location. Seattle has a mass transit system to be proud of and it was a simple 1 block wall downhill to the hotel. Cost $1.50/person versus $28 + gratuity for the taxis. We did the bus round trip and saved $60+ dollars which we spent in restaurants or souvenirs. Matt's in the Market was a great place for sandwiches....the catfish sandwich you won't find better. Pike Street Chowder on Alley Street has the best clam chowder in the City. We took advantage of the breakfast and happy hour which was well received by both of us. I don't see how they class this place as a B & B, you have all the privacy of a hotel. Room 9 was much smaller than #20. For both rooms you are near access roads from the freeway, but that never seemed to bother us. The only noise I noted was barking dogs drifting up from the garden area upon which every room open out onto with a small balconey. Bellman checked out luggage on departure day while we explored the city before our flight left. It might be another 7 years before I return to Seattle, but you bet I will checking that nothing has changed at the Inn at Harbor Steps and give them primary consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal - until 6 AM”
Reviews.Author: MarkW11
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Harbor Steps has many assets. Well located, across the street from the Seattle Art Museum and just a couple of blocks from Seattle's prime destination, the Pike Place Market, the Inn comes with all amenities, including a hot breakfast buffet and afternoon wine and cheese. The room was spacious and comfortable, although to be picky, the bathroom was starting to show its age. Located in the bottom couple of floors of a condo tower, the Inn shares facilities like exercise room and jacuzzi with the condos. This was supposed to be a romantic night in the city for a couple that lives in Seattle's far suburbs. The price was right at $140, a "last minute" special booked on the hotel's website. Parking was convenient and likewise reasonably priced at $15 for the night - self parking, with in/out privileges, a nice feature. Finding the garage's entrance is tricky and anyway should not be attempted without first parking in front of the entrance and getting directions and electronic gizmo needed to open the gate to the garage. So what was not to like? After a nice meal and a late night out, we woke to the sounds of a clock radio at 6 AM. I thought it was *our* radio, which I'd checked the night before. I ripped the cord out of the wall. No luck. I stuffed the duvet from the bed into the space between wall and nightstand, succeeding on only partially muffling the noise. Note that we're not talking about the over-loud TV next door with base notes only penetrating the wall. I can tell you the radio stations - first KIRO 710, then switched to NPR on KUOW 94.9. Apparently there is a remarkable lack of soundproofing in that area (headboards were back-to-back with the next room). It was like there was a hole in the wall. I could have called the desk, of course, but by now it wouldn't have helped, we were fully awake. All the positives from earlier in the stay were forgotten, the visit spoiled. I did contact the hotel (it's part of a chain called Four Sisters Inns) - the response: "thank you for your input". My advice: by all means, visit the Inn at Harbor Steps. Just make sure you know the layout of the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Kuhldoggie
Reviews.Content: This was a splurge for us to stay here one night while on vacation. From what I had read I had very high expectations. We were both very disappointed. It just didn't have the same feel that it did on their website. The biggest problem was the noise above our room. It sounded like people were moving furniture around. This went on from the afternoon when we checked in until after 1:00 in the morning. Security did come to our room when I finally called about 11pm. They said there was a supply closet above us for a restrraunt and the guy up there making the noise didn't seem to understand English when he trried to tell him about our complaint. The next morning at checkout all that was done was "Sorry to hear about that." It didn't ruin our trip becauase Seattle was so fun, but it did make me mad that this place was not at all what it seemed to be on line. Way too expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Out-dated and lack-lustre”
Reviews.Author: Louise072
Reviews.Content: Seattle: The Inn at Harbor Steps "Out-dated and lack-lustre" Date: March 14, 2008 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor user Very disappointed with a recent stay, as ratings have been so glowing for this hotel. While not impolite, staff lacked any sense of graciousness or enthusiasm. In the check-in process, a rapid stream of information as to "What was where" in the hotel was delivered in a robotic, barely decipherable fashion. We felt neither welcomed nor acknowledged as guests. Although clean, with a comfortable bed, the decor of our"elegant Superior Room" felt out-dated and lack-lustre. Teddy bears and cheap potpourris do not belong in a smart downtown hotel anymore, in my opinion, especially with such a totally different theme in the lobby area. There were no clean wine glasses in the Library for our afternoon drinks and the hors d'oeuvres needed refreshing, and we had to trail up to the front desk to get attention. Very over-heated room and music far too loud. Skipped the whole experience the next afternoon. Quality and assortment of the breakfast food was okay, but the fresh fruit (cantaloupe and melon) was hard and tasteless. Coffee was fine one day, thin the next. The breakfast room was windowless and felt like a generic basement conference room with a few artificial bouquets and some easy chairs thrown in an attempt to soften the effect. While there were 2 little tables set up in a corner of a much more open area overlooking the courtyard, they were jammed in alongside artificial plants and did not provide a sense of privacy from the traffic flow up and down the ramps nearby. Needless to say, we did not linger. Sadly, the place lacked a sense of presence and personality. L.D. Vancouver, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: cchri1p
Reviews.Content: The Inn Harbor Steps is a beautiful property located right across the street from the Seattle Art Museum. I stayed in two different rooms (#1 and #17) was impressed by the HUGE size and beautiful decor in both rooms. I'd have to give the edge to room 17 as it was extremely quiet and had a somewhat better layout (the bedroom was located in a separate room as opposed to room 1 which was more like a huge suite). There is free high-speed cable internet, and I was able to get free wireless internet from Tully's Coffee while in the room. The buffet breakfast include two hot entrees (usually a quiche and something else like bread pudding), fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, hot oatmeal, and a selection of juices, teas and coffee. The only drawback to the property is that it is somewhat difficult to check in/park. You have to check in on First Street, and it is often difficult to find a place in front of the Inn to wait. You will then get a parking pass, but due to the one-way nature of the streets you will have to go 2 blocks past the Inn, and make a giant U-turn to park in the back. But that's just the nature of being downtown, its not the Inn's fault! Overall, a wonderfull experience... highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Pike Place Market”
Reviews.Author: bellman1023
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn at Harbor Steps last summer. The location was just down the street (literally) from Pike Place Market. Also, my wife and I walked to and from a Mariners game which is an easy 15 minute walk. The inn itself had very spacious rooms and I loved the breakfast. I also met some interesting folks while having afternoon snacks at the hotel. All in all, I can't imagine a better option for someone wanting great location and great service in the heart of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cldKat
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay again at this hotel. The location is exceptional within 1 block to Pikes Market and the waterfront. The room was very cozy and felt like home. Nice fireplace and comfortable bed. Provided a robe and good bath products and excellent morning breakfast. The price was reasonable for all this hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Not sleepless in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: pclh
Reviews.Content: Inn at Harbor steps is an oasis of peaceful elegance in a very busy, bustling and noisy city. It was such a welcome respite from all that epitomizes a major metropolis - we didn't even hear the sirens! It was in easy walking distance of all that we wanted to see, and the concierge was most helpful in finding us good places to eat, have coffee, etc. The afternoon tea/hors d'oeuvres were a lovely touch and the breakfast was very good, with offerings of healthy cereals and yogurt, fresh fruit and three different hot dishes. The room was very spacious with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in, lots of topical magazines and local guides to read and excellent in-room coffee. My only complaint is that the lighting level was low and too poor for reading. There is an amazingly well equipped fitness room, but I did not have time to sample this. All in all, a most enjoyable stay and I would not hesitate to recommend this inn.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: honoapu
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this property before check in. Allowed to park car in garage which wasn't the easiest to find and had to wait for the room to be ready. Booked through hotel and none of the specials advertised were available so paid $179 a night before taxes; parking +$15. Weekend full breakfast, 8:00-10:00 or so, and wine reception, 4:40-6:30, included. Don't attend open wine reception late or no food, veggies, dip, cheese, fruit, cake, coffee, and wine. Located in condo on lower floors, our room had no view whatsoever. Amenites offered to condo are available to guests. Used hot tub, highly clorinated. Large bathroom but watch the towel rack, got stabbed in the shoulder twice adjusting the tub water. Comfortable room with fireplace. Easy walking to shopping, Pike's Place, eatting, and harbor. Great stay that ended with a sour note as I left a custom pillow in the room on check out and had a humdinger of a time trying to get the manager to deal with it. He finally did find the pillow, some 36 hours later, acted like sending it to me for free was a big bonus I guessfor the numerous phone calls that I had to make to him regarding the location of the pillow. Nice hotel, clean, parking resonable,and would return but don't forget anything in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: weluvseattle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 2 nights at the Inn at Harbor Steps and absolutely LOVED it! We took advantage of their stay one night/get one free Winter offer. It was a very reasonable price for 2 nights! We had a Jacuzzi/King bed room and it was more like an apartment! The room overlooked a lovely courtyard and had a fireplace in the room. It was about 2 blocks from the Pike Place Market and so convenient to downtown Seattle. We walked everywhere! The staff was so friendly & professional and went out of their way to help. They held our luggage for a few hours before check-in and also after so we could take a short trip to Bainbridge Island. The evening reception with wine/tea/snacks in the library was lovely and the morning full breakfast far exceeded our expectations! My husband also enjoyed using the fitness center and was impressed by the quality equipment. We are already thinking of making the Inn at Harbor Steps & downtown Seattle a yearly vacation! I've recommended it to everyone I know who goes to Seattle! We stayed at another "4-star" Boutique hotel downtown for our last night in Seattle and it was VERY disappointing compared to the Inn at Harbor Steps! Another bonus was getting to the Inn was easy and cheap from the Airport on the Airporter Shuttle which can drop you off 3 blocks away and you just walk downhill towards the Seattle Art Museum. I can't wait to return to Seattle again and this is the only place I'd want to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice getawy.”
Reviews.Author: tomsbaseballcards
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, one block from the waterfront and a very short walk to the market and the 5th ave. We had a very nice large room with a king size bed, jetted tub, gas fireplace and a bit of a view ot the waterfront as well as the walkway from the water to the art museum. My wife and I loved the location. Being from Seattle and having stayed at several facilities in the area, we would rate the inn at harbor steps one of the more comfortable, And a good winter value at $230.00 for two nights mid week. Complementary wine and snacks as well as the breakfast were better then expected.. Nice covered parking $15.00 per day although during our two day stay we didn't use the car once! Crab pot resturant feast on the waterfront is excellent around $20-29.00 per person depending on what you choose. Maid service was excellent, the front desk staff was young and immature. Not too professional, but that would be the only neg. My wife and I would reccomend th inn at harbor steps to anyone vititing Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A very good deal”
Reviews.Author: Roycal
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights over Thanksgiving holiday, 2007. Our rate was $175 ( plus $15.58 tax) per night. For that we got a large room and a nice breakfast buffet with both hot and cold food, along with an afternoon "tea" (wine) in the "library." You might describe the place as sort of an impersonal B & B. The location is right smack in downtown Seattle just a couple of blocks from Pike Place Market, so you can walk most anywhere you'd like in the downtown (though Seattle is hilly, if you've never been there). (We did not have a car, so I cannot comment on the parking alternatives if you do have your own car.) The "Inn" is actually two lower levels, below street level on the uphill side, of a large, fairly modern apartment building. The furnishings are a little spare, sort of "Pottery Barnish," but everything was clean and most everything worked well (thankfully a plunger was located next to the toilet). You enter a common reception lobby (no more) shared by the Inn guests and the apartment dwellers. There are two desks. One of the left for the apartments and one on the right for the Inn. There is no mixing these businesses. The appartment desk will not "give you the time of day" if you're there for the Inn. We figured that out pretty quickly. The Inn desk was very nice, however. We'd go back at the $175 price, which is much less than traditional hotels in the area. It's a good deal, given the location, assuming all you're looking for is a nice, clean, comfortable, quite room and a buffet breakfast before you head out on city.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel steps from Pike Place”
Reviews.Author: dkayal
Reviews.Content: Great place! Very good, hot buffet in a.m. Great location, close to Pike Place Market. Spacious rooms, great cocktail hour and cookies in afternoon. Highly recommended! A great deal for downtown Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “A great downtown Seattle find!”
Reviews.Author: nwtraveler03
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Inn at the Market, but they were sold out and recommended the Inn at Harbor Steps. We thought we'd give it a shot and it was more than we expected. The check-in process was simple and quick. (The only downfall being no valet parking, we had to self-park) We checked in early and the front desk held our luggage until our room was ready. Upon our return, we find that the bellhop (Jason) already delivered our luggage to our room. We checked into our spacious king room, which included complimentary beverages! One major downfall was there was no wireless internet in the room, but the staff provided us with an Ethernet cable (long enough to reach the other side of the room) to connect to their high-speed internet. We were interested in viewing the other room types and approached the front desk for a tour. Leann (believed to be the assistant manager) graciously took us to view some rooms (all of which were lovely, expect for no water views). Then later she made us dinner reservations at Elliot's (easy walk right down the harbor steps to the waterfront!) and gave us complimentary crab cakes! Breakfast was delicious especially the cheesy potatoes and bread pudding. Tea time was a nice touch, but needed to be replenished more often. We didn't have a chance to use the pool or fitness room, but it sounds nice. The staff never hesitated to assist us with our needs whether it was to make our dinner reservations or call us a cab. Overall, it was a great trip to Seattle. We were impressed by the Inn and experienced nice weather (no rain!).

Reviews.Title: “So glad we found the Inn at Harbor Steps”
Reviews.Author: ArilynneVancouver
Reviews.Content: I am very happy I found the Inn at Harbor Steps using Trip Advisor. My friend and I attended a presentation at Benaroya Hall and as I have never been to Seattle before, wanted to stay near the venue. The location is absolutely perfect! It is diagonally across from the Seattle Art Museum and just one block from Benaroya Hall and about two blocks from Pike Place Market. Our room was all that we could have hoped for. I found the decor to be charming and loved the little extras like the fluffy bathrobes, the fact that there were lot of towels in the bathroom, complementary bottled water and sodas and nice roomy sitting area with magazines. It was very quiet and very large. Our balcony overlooked the harbor steps where we could see both the harbor and the Seattle Art Museum's Hammering Man. We didn't have the opportunity to enjoy their included afternoon tea, but we did enjoy breakfast. It included hot quiche, bread pudding and hot oatmeal as well as the usual assortment of breads, muffins, cereals and drinks. As not every property suits every travellor, I will mention the challenges at this place. Checking in was a bit tricky. There are a couple of three-minute parking stalls in front and they were full when we arrived. After circling the block a few times, my friend got out of the car to register while I continued circling. We also had quite the adventure finding the correct parking area in the maze-like parking garage. Our room was located in another building that was accessible from outside and required the use of several keys to pass from one place to the other. None of these things detracted from our enjoyment of the place in the least and even added to the adventure for us. I so enjoyed my visit that I am hoping to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: msboyd
Reviews.Content: We received great service throughout our stay and made full use of the pool and other amenities. While the included breakfast is good, the ideal location near Pike Place Market makes it somewhat unnecessary, but it is a nice extra. The room was well-appointed with an interesting selection of toiletries. We would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Passtraveler
Reviews.Content: During our stay - we had nothing but wonderful experiences - from the ambience of the room with a fireplace, to the exceptional guest service at the front desk, (at all times), to the perfect downtown location, to the wonderful breakfast buffet, afternoon tea, wine and cheese and again the exceptional customer service! While yes, it can be noisy, the windows seemed sound proof, and the views not exceptional, the pros way outweigh the cons especially if you are in downtown to see the sights. While we did have an issue with the comfort of a rollaway - we were quickly moved to another room with two beds, with no hassle, charge or incovenience. When we returned from a day of sightseeing we were handed the keys to our new room! The complimentary sodas and water in the mini fridge were a nice surprise! I highly recommend the Inn at Harbor Steps! This is not your typical cookie cutter hotel environment - a pleasant change from the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “So Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: RenoHighlander
Reviews.Content: I had just one request - a quiet room. I even called the property directly to discuss which room would best meet our needs. Ended up with most expensive room, almost directly on top of a highway off ramp. First view out the window was a bus driver and vehicle full of passengers looking back at me at eye level. The constant rumble of diesel engines all day was replaced by headbanger music in the evening. The patio door almost fell on us whenever we tried to open it and seemed to be disconnected at the top.(We were later told this was some sort of European styling) There was an unpainted patch on the wall by this door (indicating others couldn't figure it out either), the bar sink did not drain and the thermostat made the room hotter when turned down. The adjustable shower head could not be adjusted unless the water was turned off, which meant repeated guessing...The two young ladies who presided at the desk when we checked in were not technically rude, but were certainly not warm, welcoming or the slightest bit interested in their customers. I thought this would be a nice alternative to a large hotel, but would never recommend this place to anyone. If you stay here, avoid Room 10!

Reviews.Title: “stay at the inn”
Reviews.Author: audierolnick
Reviews.Content: excellent stay, perfect location, beautiful facilities, nice people, loved it here, sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Inn at the Harbor Steps”
Reviews.Author: rickygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed athe Inn at Harbor steps for my daugters Sweet 16 Birthday. The hotel was elegant and clean! The room was elegant and very cozy. There were alot of extras included that we didnt expect. The location was excellent! Two blocks to Pikes market and two blocks to the piers. We were three girls and felt very safe! We would definately stay there again!!! They had a teddy bear, balloons, and chocolates waiting for my daugter when we arrived!!! She loved it, plus a bear for each of us. A very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: terrijmc
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit. The location is perfect. Very close to Pike Place Market and several wonderful restaurants. Our KIng room was beyond our expectations. The bed was very comfortable and the room very large with nice furnishings. The afternoon wine and tea time was nice and the morning breakfast was excellent. Staff were extreemly helpful. We hated to leave and most definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: HopefultravellerUk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the lower part of a tower block in downtown Seattle and is in a great position for exploring the waterfront, Pike's Market etc. The room was big but gloomy and the aircon was like a jumbo taking off at times: luckily I didn't really need to use it while I was there. A reasonable breakfast is included and there is wine and nibbles in the library at 4.30pm. Not exceptional but worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: reels
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Harbor is a great place to stay. The room was clean, large and the beds were wonderful. The location was great, within walking distance to Pikes Market. The people were friendly and the breakfast was just right. I would stay there again and hope to get the chance to stay longer. This place is really unique!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MTravels
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this nice Inn when you visit Seattle. We stayed 2 nights here before catching our cruise for Alaska. It's a great location right next to Pike Place Market and the ports...can walk to Space Needle or SafeCo field for a ballgame, and Pioneer Sq area. The Inn is located at the bottom of an apartment building. The rooms are very spacious (much larger than chain hotels that charge much more), and quaint....ours had a fireplace and cute decor (including a teddy bear on the bed). They surprised us with balloons for our anniversary too (nice touch). Rates include free breakfast, and we aren't talking stale donuts here. A chef actually is baking quiche and other delectable goodies. The concierge was very helpful in recommending restaurants (try the Brooklyn for excellent fish just a few blocks away or the Brazilian place next door).

Reviews.Title: “One of Seattle's Best Establishments”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSkeeter
Reviews.Content: Just a note to let you all know how pleased I was with the services at your establishment! My stay during the week of August 20-23 in Seattle was very pleasant and enjoyable. Quiet, cleanliness, courtesy and customer service was what I experienced at the Inn at Harbor Steps. The room was comforting even providing reading material for my leisure time. The decor in the room was unique, tasteful and well designed. Your exceptional services should be recognized by all clients at your Inn. I've never had such a soothing nights stay at any other hotel I've visited. The food, beverages and service were excellent when I was able to sit down and take the time to enjoy it. As the travel coordinator for a federal agency I have requested to have this lodging establishment added to our "preferred" List. Next time in Seattle I will definitely stay at the Inn at Harbor Steps! Thanks for such fabulous accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: KCBW
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place. Rooms were very clean (had 2), nice size of each. Had some free pop & water bottles in each room! Nice! Nice free breakfast which included meat, eggs, potatoes,etc....Sat out in inner woodsy courtyard & ate - pretty! They have a reg. pool & jacuzzi in one tower & a jacuzzi & a small endless pool & workout room in the other. Only problem in Room B18 (see pic-where man is standing) was the air conditioner was around the wall from queen bed & was so low to floor we had to kneel on floor to see controls & then it didn't cool the room down. The weather outside was 75-80 degrees that day & our room all NIGHT was 76!! We feel it was also due to the fact we were the floor above the garage & was it ever warm down there! Couldn't stand that more than 15 minutes! Bathrooms were large & clean. see pic. Had fireplace didn't use of course! It did have a door & window to open to a green courtyard space & that was very pretty for being right downtown. Very quiet!! Overall was nice but the 2 Queen room we had in other tower was nice & overlooked steps & had a small balconey. VERY roomy!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Girlypanda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights for a wedding and we loved it! Check in was quick. We had a king spa room and found it to be more than adequate. The room and bathroom were quite large. We really appreciated the kitchenette with small fridge (with drinks!), coffee maker, and table. The room also had a fireplace, computer table, and TV cabinet. The bathroom was great with a jacuzzi and separate shower. As mentioned in the previous reviews, the windows are funky and open at an angle. Our room (#1) had a peek a boo view of the harbor and was adjacent to the harbor steps, but we never had any problems with noise. It was a little warm in our room when we arrived but it cooled off quickly with the air conditioner in the room. The inn does not have wireless access but provides ethernet cables and have a fast connection. Garage parking is $15/day. Local newspaper at the door was a nice touch in the morning. We found the breakfast in the morning to be great. We noticed that the muffins, eggs, quiche, potatoes were all made that morning in the kitchen and were restocked quickly by the staff. We also liked the afternoon tea time with wine, fruit/cheese, and desserts. We did not use the gym, but walked by it and thought it looked nice. Probably our favorite part was the in room jacuzzi, it was large and very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Much more than a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: lowkeyguy
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Harbor Steps is a very nice hotel on the bottom floors of a high rise apartment building. Our room was equivalent to a Hyatt Regency room (large, very high ceiling, atrium doors to the Harbor Steps, very nicely decorated, wet bar with refrigerator, etc.). The afternoon tea/wine/hors doeurves are served in a very nice Library. The full cooked breakfast is served in the Garden Room. We enjoyed the breakfast so much that we asked the front desk if we could return for breakfast the day our cruise ship returned to Seattle and invite friends from the Seattle area to join us, even though we would not be staying at the hotel. They said sure and only charged us $10 per person. Parking ($15/night) is in a secure parking garage that connects to the hotel. Health club is very nice -- exercise room, lap pool, jetted tub (all included in the room rate). We would stay at this hotel anytime we are in Seattle. Although it is not cheap (approx. $185 plus tax) it is well worth the price, especially considering the excellent breakfast and the tea/wine/hors doeurves.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Griffy234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn at the Harbor Steps August 11-14 2007. This is a great downtown location that is in within walking distance to all the major attractions. The rooms are very very clean and spacious. The staff is friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast is great...hot and cold choices and cooked right there by the hotel chef. The Inn shares it's space with an apartment building so you feel like you have your own apartment. It's also a secure building that requires a special key to get in and out which is a good safety feature. They have a lovely wine and cheese reception which is complimentary and great after a full day of sightseeing. Parking is a bit strange in the garage but is provided at only 15.00 a day which is a good value. The hotel also only charges 8% tax as it's a small boutique property where the major chains charge 16%. Overall this is a great choice and a hidden gem in Seattle!!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt right at home -- wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: ProudHarvardMom
Reviews.Content: We just returned a few days ago, and I miss the hotel already. The room was large with a small kitchenette, fireplace, air conditioning, and most importantly, it was quiet, which we appreciated very much. We stayed both at the beginning of our Seattle/Victoria BC trip and at the end. The location is walking distance from a lot of the fun things to do in Seattle, such as Pike's Market, shopping, IMAX theater, waterfront, and more. The Seattle Art Museum (SAM) is just across the street. The staff is helpful, and there are two computers we used in the lobby free of charge. We went to the Boeing tour, and the bus picked us up right at the hotel. We took a Victoria Clipper ferry, and it was only a $6 taxi ride to get to the dock. The hotel arranged a Lincoln car ride for us to go to the Seattle airport for our return flight home. Breakfast at Inn@Harbor Steps was delicious and the room is elegant with soft music in the background. The Inn has an afternoon wine and cheese reception every day from 4:30 to 6:30 in the gorgeous library. I can't wait to return, and I recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Harbor Steps is Seattles Dirty little secret”
Reviews.Author: Leebaker
Reviews.Content: I knew that this place was in downtown close to Pike's Place, but I didn't think it would be in a highrise! It was very convenient to be 3 blocks from Pike's Place and right across from the Seattle Art Museum. But parking a car in there parking garage was awful. It was very hot and cost $15 to park. My three sisters and I had a room with 2 queen beds and one rollaway. The rollaway was there but standing right in the middle of the entryway and standing on it headboard, not made. The room had no toiletties or towels and washcloths for 4 people. When we did get some toiletties it was 4 bottles of conditioner and no shampoo.Also the tiolet was dirty on the outside of the bowl with #2 on it 'Yuck" !! and the Bathtub tile had mildew stains everywhere, walls were dirty as well as floors. I guess they don't have someone come in and inspect the housekeeper work. The staff at the Inn was one guy at the desk and one houskeeper I saw the next morning. I also was disappointed in the lack of helpfullness or apologies for the 4 phone calls to request items that should have been in the room. Also on their website it says they have fresh baked cookies in the lobby and we saw none . I asked about they and they laughed at me. The breakfast was ok, oatmeal was very dry, cooking in a crockpot and there was a staff of 2 in the backcounter asking to put lids back on food.I was very disappionted in this place and reccomened not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Good ~ The Bad”
Reviews.Author: CatbirdEastTN
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in mid June. The Good Excellent location, convenient to downtown sights. Helpful staff, very good breakfast and afternoon tea. Free internet service, large clean rooms. The Bad When we entered our room, we noticed how warm it was. I called the front desk and someone was sent to check the portable air conditioning system and show us how it worked. That evening we returned to a very warm room. Again someone was quick to come to the room. They said the heat was on, and they also pulled a large fan from the closet and told us it helped to open the sliding glass door and pull the warm air out. For two nights in order to be half way comfortable we slept with the sliding glass door open and a fan going. OK in the country, but not in a large city with a interstate road 1 block away. The portable air condtioning units they have are worthless for cooling. Address the cooling problems and this would be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: NJNora
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this inn and it has yet to disappoint. Rooms are beautifully decorated, large and comfortable. Each has a fireplace and wet bar that includes a fridge with complimentary soft drinks and water. Bathrooms are enormous, the toiletries are lux. and robes are included in the rooms. The Inn is situated on the bottom floors of an apartment building but they have made it work by having french doors in all the rooms open onto a zen garden. It is located near Pike Place Market and across from the Seattle Art Museum. Trendy restaurants are nearby. Breakfast is a full and delicious one - no stale croissaints here. Lovely wine and hors d'oeuvres are served each evening in the library. Staff are pleasant and helpful. A great place to spend your nights in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: RCBPortland
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an overnight stay. What a great location! Walking distance to pike place martket, waterfront and not too far to Safeco Field. There are plenty of restaurants and bars close by. There was a nice afternoon reception and a complimentary breakfast buffet. The room was comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly. A lovely stay, a lovery place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to waterfront & Pike Place”
Reviews.Author: odhrty
Reviews.Content: My three 38 - 41 yr old girlfriends and i just returned from 2 nights in Seattle. Two of us took a city bus to the hotel and checked the bags until the room was ready and the other two rented a rental car from the airport. You have to pull up at the front of the hotel and unload from the street, get your keys and then back your car around the block in the parking garage and take an elevator back up to the lobby. Traffic was bad and i missed the one way turn to get me in front of the hotel so i went directly to the parking garage. Fortunately someone that lived there unlocked the elevator door so we could go up to the lobby. You must check in first because your room key is also the elevator key. We had two queen beds in a very spacious room, refridgerator, and balcony. All two queen beds overlook the Harbor steps and we could also see the water and pier from our room. They do not advertise these rooms as waterfront but you could see the water when sitting on the right side of the patio table (comes with 2 chairs) from all of these rooms facing the Harbor steps SW tower( i believe) You do look past the freeway to see the harbor area. The room is not sound proof and ear plugs would be necessary for light sleepers. We could here road noise and the door opening into our hallway at night. Our Room #64 was right next to this entrance door. We enjoyed the morning breakfast of quiche, potatoes, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal, cakes ect. The free pop and water in the room was a nice touch. Except there was only 2 sodas and one water our first night and we were paying for four of us in a room. House keeping left 8 the next night. The afternoon wine was average and they din't have anyone working the room. We were told to come up and ask if the wine ran out but who wants to run up and ask. Two of us ran along the waterfront in the morning, down the harbor steps and one block further. The Argosy cruise loads right there. We jogged down to the edgewater hotel and circled around pike street for Starbucks and French pastries at 7:30 am on a Sunday. There are many food choices nearby. The Seattle museum is directly across the street and one day we hopped a city bus that stopped in front of it to the Seattle center, walked around there and took the monorail near the Space needle to Westlake mall for shopping. Nordstroms and Macy's ect are all right around here. We walked back to the hotel from there. If you love wine the Purple Cafe was fun and had alot of energy. We felt a little under dressed but sat at the bar and forgot about it after a few glasses of wine. We had dinner at the Wild Ginger a couple blocks away it was about $50 a person with drink and dinner. Lots of energy here too. A reservation is advised. I would definitely stay here again. While i was here on a girls weekend i would bring my family. (kids 9 and 10) There was a pool, sauna, hottubs, weight room, barbque area, indoor basketball court. However I only noticed one family with kids there while we were there. I joggged by the waterfront Marriot which is on the opposite end of the waterfront and thought this would also be a good choice. Its closer to the Space Needle and you can enter pike street from the opposite end. It appears to have serveral different size balconies which look toward the water and the indoor/outdoor pool looked cool. Its close the the cruise ships sailing to Alaska and would be a great hotel to stay in before a cruise. I hope this helps. Enjoy your travels and remember to take the time to right a review for the rest of us:)

Reviews.Title: “my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: P.Nelson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Inn at the Harbor steps many times over the past four years. There have been times when I have been in Seattle when the location has not worked for the event that I am attending, or when there is no room available, and I find that I am always comparing the substitute with Harbor Steps and wishing I were there. Whereas I cannot say that my stays have always been without a gliche, the fact is that life is not perfect and I just frankly don't expect it to be. Mistakes happen, and it would be foolish of me not to accept that they are no more perfect than I am. I did have a time when there was a lot of movement in the room above my head, but it was when they were moving offices and that was what created the problem. They compensated me for the noise. All but one of the employees has been gracious and helpful and friendly. The one that was not...I reported the incident and know that the employee will learn from the mistake. The location, the usual extreme quiet, the wonderful relaxing breakfast and the afternoon receptions are too great to be overshadowed by an incident now and then. It is my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, rough 2nd night”
Reviews.Author: arachne
Reviews.Content: Huge room, great location, right in town, first night was good, but on the second night, from 11 PM until I finally fell to sleep about 3(after Ambien and earplugs), it sounded as though there was a bowling party going on in the room above ours. I called the front desk--the young woman didn't seem to know where the rooms were located in the hotel(it is rather labyrinthine), was profusely apologetic, said she'd get right on it, but the noise continued, and started up again at 9 AM, awakening me. When we were leaving, we walked by the room above ours, just as a young male employee was walking through the door, which had a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the knob. I complained upon checking out, the receptionist said that no one was staying in the room, and she had no idea where the noise was coming from. So I dunno, maybe an employee breakroom? An improptu party?...

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: cannicUk
Reviews.Content: This must be the best place to stay in Seattle - could not be better sited for Downtown shops, moments away from the monorail to the Space Needle, straight out the door for the harbor area, and a brilliant Brazillian restaurant right next door. The rooms are huge, comfortable, with a private garden outside. Clean and relaxing, with reading areas, gas fires and wonderful bathrooms. Room booking charges include afternoon wine & canapes, and the breakfast is homemade and wonderful after years of predictable and bland hotel buffets! The staff cannot do enough for you, from booking tables for dinner, arranging taxis to recommending activities.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location but there were problems...”
Reviews.Author: krj1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Inn at Harbor Steps for four days during our vacation in Seattle. We thought the location of the Inn could not be better!
